0.title: Mumbai airport to remain shut for 6 hours today due to maintenance, repair work
0.article_body: Mumbai's Chhatrapati Shivaji Maharaj International Airport (CSMIA) said that both the runways, RWY 14/32 and 09/27, will remain non-operational on Tuesday from 11 am to 5 pm due to pre-monsoon maintenance and repair work. "All operations will resume as usual post 5 pm," it added. The authorities have advised passengers to check the flight schedules to avoid any inconveniences.

1.title: Cash agent assaulted by thugs, robbed of ₹7 lakh in Noida
1.article_body: A cash collection agent was assaulted by unidentified bike-borne assailants in Noida on Monday. The victim, identified as Pramod Kumar Sahni, was robbed of ₹6.8 lakh by the assailants. According to the police, the accused were tailing Sahni before intercepting him near the Mahagun Mezzaria society which falls under Noida's Sector 113 police station.

2.title: Vijay Deverakonda to appear on Koffee with Karan 7: Reports
2.article_body: Vijay Deverakonda will reportedly make his 'Koffee with Karan' debut with the upcoming season of the talk show. "[He] has made it to...guestlist for Koffee with Karan 7. In most probability, he'll be appearing with Ananya Panday, his Liger co-star," reports said. "However, there were discussions on if Rashmika Mandanna might join him on...show instead of Ananya," reports further said.

3.title: Batters were poor, let us down; that's been our story: Rohit on loss vs KKR
3.article_body: Discussing MI's loss by 52 runs against KKR, MI captain Rohit Sharma said it was a "poor" performance with the bat, adding that the batters let the team down. "That has been the story for us," stated Rohit. "I am disappointed with the way we batted," he said. It was MI's ninth defeat in IPL 2022.

4.title: State agency destroyed archaeological remains around Puri temple: ASI to HC
4.article_body: Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) told Orissa High Court that state construction agency has destroyed archaeological remains around 12th century Jagannatha Temple in Puri. "At several locations...it is evident...removal of about 15-20 feet stratified deposit have taken place," ASI said, adding, "Odisha Bridge and Construction Corporation officials were...clueless about method of soil removal."

5.title: Far-reaching ramifications: Centre seeks time from SC on minority status for Hindus
5.article_body: The Centre has sought more time from Supreme Court to make up its mind on providing minority status for Hindus in states where their numbers are less than other communities. The government said the issue has "far-reaching ramifications" and needed more discussions with "state governments and other stakeholders". The government was replying to a plea by advocate Ashwini Kumar Upadhyay.

6.title: Cowardly act by those who want to disturb peace: Kejriwal on Mohali blast
6.article_body: AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal condemned the bomb blast incident that took place at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali. "Mohali blast is a cowardly act of those who want to disturb the peace of Punjab. AAP’s Punjab government will not allow those people's wishes to be fulfilled," Kejriwal tweeted. "The culprits will be punished severely," he added.

7.title: US-based Grid Dynamics to setup India's 1st operational centre at Hyderabad
7.article_body: US-based Grid Dynamics, a digital transformation services and solutions firm, on Monday announced the setting up of its first operational centre in India at Hyderabad. "We're sure that the Hyderabad centre will exceed all its growth estimates," said Telangana IT Minister KT Rama Rao. The centre is expected to employ 1,000 engineers from the region by the end of 2022.

8.title: Man attacked for refusing to pay extortion money in Pune; 3 held
8.article_body: Three people have been arrested after a 43-year-old man, who runs a laundry in Pune's Narhe, was allegedly attacked by four persons with a sharp knife after he refused to pay extortion money. A search is on for the fourth accomplice. The police added that a 29-year-old man was also attacked while parking a vehicle in the Narhe area.

9.title: Spent 2-3 days in just a towel in hotel in Mumbai as airline lost my luggage: DC's Powell
9.article_body: DC batter Rovman Powell revealed he had to spend two-three days wearing just a towel in his hotel room when he landed in Mumbai as the airline lost his luggage. He added, "I was told the airline didn't have...my bags. The only thing I had with me was my hand baggage when I left airport...I didn't have any extra clothes."

10.title: Fire breaks out at diesel shed near Ludhiana railway station
10.article_body: A major fire broke out at the Northern Railways' diesel shed near Ludhiana railway station around 1:50 pm on Monday. The fire reportedly started after someone discarded a smoked cigarette near the waste engine oil and waste diesel filters at the shed. Though several waste service parts were gutted in the incident, no injuries or casualties were reported.

11.title: What are the best bowling figures in IPL history?
11.article_body: MI's Jasprit Bumrah on Monday recorded the fifth-best bowling figures in IPL history after registering figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR. The best bowling figures were recorded by Alzarri Joseph in 2019, when he took six wickets for 12 runs for MI against SRH. Sohail Tanvir and Adam Zampa are other two bowlers to take six wickets in an IPL match.

12.title: 13-year-old Class 8 student found hanging from window in school in UP
12.article_body: The body of a 13-year-old boy, a Class 8 student, was found hanging with a scarf from the window at his school in Uttar Pradesh's Jaunpur on Monday, police said. The student was not coming to the school for the last three days, the principal said. It was not known when he came to the school premises, the principal added.

13.title: Josh Talks raises $3.5 million, Paytm and OYO CEO invest too
13.article_body: Josh Talks has raised $3.5 million in a funding round led by Ankur Capital. Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma, Better Capital Founder Vaibhav Domkundwar, SUGAR Cosmetics CEO Vineeta Singh and OYO CEO Ritesh Agarwal also participated in the funding. Founded in 2015, Josh Talks has showcased 3000 stories in 10 vernacular languages garnering as of October 2021.

14.title: Russia's ambassador drenched with red paint thrown by protestors in Poland
14.article_body: Russia's ambassador to Poland Sergey Andreev was drenched with red paint thrown by protestors as he arrived to honour Red Army troops who died during the Second World War. The ambassador was seen wiping away paint from his face in a video of the incident. The demonstrators carried Ukrainian flags and chanted "fascist".

15.title: Didn't feel awkward: Ranveer Brar on playing gay couple with Pratik Gandhi
15.article_body: Celebrity chef Ranveer Brar, who will be seen in 'Modern Love', said that it did not feel awkward to play a gay couple with actor Pratik Gandhi. "I think we had...met earlier...we had already reached a place where we didn't have to start from scratch. So, you know there was a certain level of comfort we had reached," he added.

16.title: Putin does not have a way out of Ukraine war: Biden
16.article_body: US President Joe Biden said that Russian President Vladimir Putin doesn't have a way out of the Ukraine war. He said that Putin "doesn't have a way out right now and I'm trying to figure out what we do about that". Biden added that Putin was wrong to believe that the war will break up NATO and the European Union.

17.title: When are you coming to deliver 1st Tesla?: Paytm CEO on Musk's Taj Mahal tweet
17.article_body: Paytm CEO Vijay Shekhar Sharma took to Twitter to react to Tesla CEO Elon Musk's tweet on the Taj Mahal. Sharma tweeted, "It'll be an incredible challenge for Tesla to build FSD for India. We're known to be the most unruly road users. That said, when are you coming here to deliver the first Tesla here at the Taj?

18.title: Had goosebumps in many scenes, my throat dried up: Mahesh Babu on 'Major'
18.article_body: Mahesh Babu who is producing the upcoming film 'Major' said there were many sequences in the movie where he experienced goosebumps, adding that his throat dried up in the last 30 minutes. "After the film got over, I was quiet for two minutes," stated Mahesh. 'Major' is based on the life of National Security Guard (NSG) commando Major Sandeep Unnikrishnan.

19.title: Employee of engineering firm booked for corporate espionage in Ahmedabad
19.article_body: Ahmedabad Cyber Crime Cell has booked Rajnikant Patel, an employee of AIA Engineering Limited for alleged corporate espionage. He reportedly divulged secret Research and Development (R&D) material regarding the company's heat department to a rival company based in Jharkhand's Jamshedpur. Patel, who is part of AIA since 1994, had allegedly transferred confidential documents to his private e-mail.

20.title: 25-yr-old woman, minor daughter found dead in Tapi river in Gujarat
20.article_body: The bodies of a 25-year-old woman and her one-and-a-half-year-old daughter tied with a dupatta were found in Tapi river in Gujarat's Surat on Monday. Dipali Sagar Devey had left home on the afternoon of May 6 with her minor daughter without informing her husband. When they did not return home by the evening, Sagar filed a complaint with the police.

21.title: 6 people held for terrorising residents in Pune
21.article_body: Six people were arrested by the police for spreading terror in Pune. The gang members are accused of brandishing weapons and terrorising residents in the city's Chatuhshrungi and Samartha areas. According to the police, two of the six accused are juveniles while the others are identified as Shubham Khandagale (21), Vinayak Kapade (20), Yash Holekar (21) and Sainath Patole (21).

22.title: Female officer on the run with prisoner dies after car chase in US
22.article_body: A 56-year-old female jail officer, who tried to run off with a prisoner, allegedly shot and killed herself following a car chase in the US. Casey White, the 38-year-old prisoner who is a murder suspect, surrendered after the vehicle crashed during a police pursuit in Indiana. Vicky White, the officer, was taken to a hospital where she died.

23.title: Karnataka reports 90 new cases of COVID-19; 88 in Bengaluru alone
23.article_body: Karnataka on Monday reported 90 new cases of COVID-19, out of which 88 cases were reported from state capital, Bengaluru, alone. According to data published by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike (BBMP), the city reported zero deaths due to COVID-19 on Monday, whereas 122 people recovered from the virus. The positivity rate in the city now stands at 1.4%, data showed.

24.title: Regular FIR to be filed against Raj minister's son on rape charges: Police
24.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday said that the process to turn the zero FIR into a regular one has begun against Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi's son, Rohit Joshi. This comes after a 23-year-old woman from Jaipur alleged that Joshi raped her on multiple occasions for over a year and also sexually assaulted her in a hotel in Delhi's Sadar Bazar.

25.title: Politicians should use decent language in public: HC in Lakhimpur case
25.article_body: Allahabad High Court has observed that politicians in high posts should use "decent language" in public "considering its repercussions" while hearing bail pleas in the Lakhimpur Kheri violence case. The court said this while referring to the Special Investigation Team's chargesheet, which concluded that the violence wouldn't have happened if Union Minister Ajay Mishra hadn't threatened farmers.

26.title: He was from Hindustan: Akshay on being asked if Prithviraj was from Guj or Raj
26.article_body: Akshay Kumar, during the trailer launch of 'Prithviraj', replied to a journalist who asked, "Where was Samrat Prithviraj Chauhan from - Gujarat or Rajasthan?" "He was from Hindustan...he was the son of Bharat Mata," Akshay said, adding, "Let's leave the question about where he was from...the most important thing is that he was from our country and that is enough."

27.title: Tesla halts production at China plant due to supply issues: Report
27.article_body: Tesla has halted production at its Shanghai plant due to issues with securing parts for its EVs, Reuters reported citing sources. Tesla's Shanghai plant produces the Model 3 sedan and Model Y crossover for the China market and for export. Tesla partially resumed production at the plant on April 19 following a 22-day closure caused by the city's COVID-19 lockdown.

28.title: Over 3 cr children between 12-14 yrs given 1st dose of COVID vaccine
28.article_body: Over three crore adolescents between the 12-14 age group have received the first dose of the COVID-19 vaccine so far, the Union Health Ministry said on Monday. COVID-19 vaccination for this age group was started on March 16, 2022. Similarly, the COVID-19 precaution dose administration for the age group 18-59 years began from April 10, 2022.

29.title: 12-year-old boy dies after consuming 'poisonous herb' in J&K, 3 hospitalised
29.article_body: A 12-year-old boy died while three kids were hospitalised after they consumed a poisonous herb in a forest near Rakhjaroh village in Jammu and Kashmir's Ramban district. The deceased, identified as Mohammad Basit, fell unconscious before being declared dead. However, the other three kids, identified as Shabnam (10), Sania (10) and Razia (8), have been referred to a Jammu-based hospital.

30.title: Bitcoin briefly drops below $30,000 for first time since July 2021
30.article_body: Bitcoin, in the early hours of Tuesday, fell below $30,000 for the first time since July 2021. Its value fell as low as $29,764 on Tuesday before recovering above $30,000. Bitcoin's value has more than halved from its all-time high which was close to $69,000 in November. The fall in cryptocurrencies followed a drop in US equities and other markets.

31.title: Lightspeed to invest in Razorpay's $75 mn secondary share sale
31.article_body: Lightspeed Venture Partners and Moore Strategic Ventures will pick up stakes in B2B payments platform Razorpay as part of a $75 million secondary share sale. Razorpay has offered to buy back stock options worth up to $75 million from 650 former and existing employees. This is Razorpay's fourth and biggest ESOP buyback since it started operations.

32.title: Whoever tried to spoil Punjab's atmosphere won't be spared: CM on Mohali blast
32.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann took to Twitter to say that police is probing the blast that took place at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali on Monday. "Whoever tried to spoil the atmosphere of Punjab will not be spared," he wrote on Twitter. Police had termed the blast "minor" and said investigation is underway.

33.title: India reports 2,288 new COVID-19 cases, a drop of 28.6% in daily cases
33.article_body: India has reported 2,288 COVID-19 cases, 3,044 recoveries and 10 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,207 COVID-19 cases and 29 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 19,637, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,103.

34.title: Holy moly! My husband is fire: Sanjana Ganesan after Bumrah takes 5 wickets
34.article_body: After MI fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah took five wickets for 10 runs against KKR in their IPL 2022 match on Monday, Bumrah's wife and presenter Sanjana Ganesan tweeted, "Holy moly! My husband is [fire]." "Your husband is the greatest bowler in the whole world, remember that," a fan tweeted. Bumrah has taken 10 wickets in IPL 2022 so far.

35.title: After Musk's Taj Mahal tweet, his mother says his grandparents flew there in 1954
35.article_body: After Elon Musk tweeted he visited Taj Mahal in 2007 and called it a "wonder of the world", his mother Maye Musk shared that his grandparents flew to the Taj Mahal from South Africa in 1954. She tweeted, "The only people to ever do this trip in a single-engine propeller plane, without a radio or GPS. Their motto 'Live dangerously...carefully'."

36.title: Mom raised me as single parent, so I take up all women-centric films: Rampal
36.article_body: Arjun Rampal, speaking at the song launch of 'Dhaakad' in Jaipur, said, "My mom raised me as a single parent. Whenever I get an offer for...woman-centric film, I take it up immediately." "This is my way of paying homage to my mother...I know how strong she was," he added. Directed by Razneesh Ghai, the action film also stars Kangana Ranaut.

37.title: Govt turned sedition law into propaganda machine: Cong’s Surjewala
37.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Singh Surjewala said the Centre turned the sedition law into a "personal propaganda machine" and sent lakhs of people behind the bars. "In eight years, the (PM) Modi government has charged nearly all journalists, independent commentators, educationists or political rivals with sedition law...We must expose the government and show its undemocratic nature," Surjewala added.

38.title: Jr NTR is the only hero who doesn't practice dance: Choreographer Sekhar
38.article_body: Choreographer Sekhar Master said 'RRR' actor Jr NTR is the "only hero" who does not practice dance moves, adding that he only needs one glance to perfectly imitate them. "Jr NTR doesn't even keep up with his dance strikes," stated Sekhar. "He does not need rehearsals," said Sekhar. Jr NTR's recent film 'RRR' also starred Ram Charan.

39.title: Marilyn Monroe painting sells for record-breaking ₹1,500 crore
39.article_body: A painting of Marilyn Monroe by Andy Warhol has been auctioned for $195 million (over ₹1,500 crore), making it the most expensive piece of 20th Century art ever sold. The painting, Shot Sage Blue Marilyn, was painted by Warhol in 1964. The amount is also the highest ever paid for an American work of art.

40.title: 2 sisters mistakenly marry each other's grooms after power failure in MP
40.article_body: Two sisters who were getting married on the same day in Madhya Pradesh's Ujjain, accidentally married the wrong grooms due to a power failure. Since both the brides were in veils and wearing similar dresses, they happened to perform the wedding ceremony with the wrong grooms. The mix-up was realised after the grooms took the brides to their respective homes.

41.title: Shabana felt insecure with love he showered on me: Tanvi Azmi on father-in-law
41.article_body: Actress Tanvi Azmi said that actress and sister-in-law Shabana Azmi sometimes felt insecure when her father Kaifi Azmi showered love on Tanvi. "He used to call Shabana 'chiriya' and 'gulab ka phool'...Once he happened to tell me, 'You're my rose flower'...Shabana overheard that and all hell broke loose. She asked him, 'Abba, you called Tanvi a rose flower?'" she added.

42.title: Sedition law absolutely unnecessary in free country: Ex-Union Minister
42.article_body: Ex-Union Law Minister Ashwani Kumar said sedition law seems "absolutely unnecessary" in a free country. "We should support the repeal of this law or its comprehensive revising," Kumar added. "The kind of abuse (of the sedition law) we have seen in the last few months and years is unparalleled...What we have seen in last few months is unforgivable," he stated.

43.title: 54 detonators with low-intensity explosives found in bag at Nagpur Railway Station
43.article_body: A bag containing 54 detonators with low-intensity explosives was found in front of Nagpur Railway Station's main gate on Monday around 8 pm. Railway Protection Force (RPF) and Bomb Detection and Disposal Squads (BDDS) teams are investigating it, a railway official said. Detonators contained explosive content as good as a cracker, Nagpur Police Commissioner Amitesh Kumar said.

44.title: Punjab on high alert after blast at Police Intelligence office in Mohali
44.article_body: Punjab was put on high alert on Monday night after a bomb blast took place at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali. The Punjab Police had termed the explosion "minor" and said that probe into the matter was underway. Meanwhile, pictures from the spot showed shattered doors and window panes.

45.title: Train derails near Vienna in Austria; 1 killed, several injured
45.article_body: At least one person was killed and several others were injured when a train derailed near Austria's Vienna on Monday, said the Red Cross. The incident occurred at around 6 pm local time, after which a team of rescue workers and four emergency helicopters were deployed to the scene. Two of the carriages were seen lying overturned on the ground.

46.title: Microsoft to help cover US employees' travel costs for abortion
46.article_body: Microsoft has said that it will cover travel costs for employees in the US who need to travel out of state for an abortion. The move comes after a recent draft leak from US Supreme Court proposed abolishing abortion rights nationwide. Several companies, including Yelp, Tesla and Amazon, among others have pledged to cover this cost for their American employees.

47.title: Drunk man urinates in front of neighbour's house in Delhi, killed in fight
47.article_body: A 44-year-old property dealer, Parveen Lamba, was killed in Delhi after he got into fight with his neighbour, Rahul Malhotra, after urinating in front of Rahul's house in drunk state in Delhi. Both parties threw stones at each other during fight. Malhotra and his father threw bottles at Lamba, one of which, hurt his leg and he started bleeding profusely.

48.title: US announces free internet plan for crores of low-income citizens
48.article_body: The US government has announced a programme under which free internet will be provided to crores of low-income citizens. President Joe Biden's administration said that 20 internet companies have agreed to provide discounted $30 monthly plans for 100 Mbps to 4.8 crore households. Combined with the government's $30 monthly internet subsidy, the service will be free for crores of people.

49.title: 6 people arrested with petrol bombs, lethal weapons in Bengaluru
49.article_body: The Bengaluru Police arrested six people belonging to two different gangs and seized petrol bombs, a country pistol and sharp-edged weapons from them. According to police, the gangs were planning to attack each other and create social unrest in the city. The accused had purchased 19 beer bottles and filled 10 bottles with petrol, DCP (East) Bheemashankar Guled said.

50.title: 38-year-old man beaten to death in road rage incident in Pune
50.article_body: A 38-year-old man was beaten to death by three persons on Lavasa Road in Pune in a road rage case, police said. The incident took place near Andgaon village on Sunday after one of the accused did not allow the victim and his cousin to pass. The deceased was on his way to meet his wife and children, police added.

51.title: Scaler’s Data Science program opens doors for non-coders
51.article_body: Scaler shares that its Data Science & Analytics program is here to equip users with data-driven business decision-making skills, regardless of coding experience. Experienced users can dive deeper into coding with the Machine Learning program to solve business problems at scale. It added that their Masterclass could be the entry point in someone's Data Science career.

52.title: CEO is also involved in team selections: KKR captain Shreyas Iyer on frequent changes
52.article_body: During the presentation ceremony after their victory against MI, KKR captain Shreyas Iyer revealed that the franchise CEO Venky Mysore is also involved in team selections. Iyer was answering a question on frequent changes to their playing XI. Iyer added that it is really difficult to tell players about axings. "Each and every player takes it well," he added.

53.title: Indian Railways introduces foldable 'baby berth' in Lucknow Mail, pics surface
53.article_body: Indian Railways' Northern Railway has introduced 'baby berth' in Lucknow Mail on Mother's Day. The Northern Railway Lucknow Division tweeted, "A baby berth has been introduced in Coach no 194129/ B4, berth no 12 & 60 in Lucknow Mail, to facilitate mothers travelling with their baby. Fitted baby seat is foldable about hinge and is secured with a stopper."

54.title: Played special music as Akshay walked from vanity to sets: Prithviraj director
54.article_body: 'Prithviraj' director Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi said that the team had recorded a special music track for actor Akshay Kumar. "We used to play that music for him when he would walk from his vanity van to the sets of Prithviraj. This was done so that he would leave behind present era and travel to the era of Prithviraj," he added.

55.title: Dangerous: Cyberabad Traffic Police on video of red light accident
55.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Monday shared a video of an accident caused due to vehicles jumping a red light and said that doing so "always" puts a person in "danger". The video shows a truck colliding with two vehicles that purportedly jumped the red light at a crossing. The traffic police also used the hashtags "#RoadSafetyCyberabad and #RoadSafety".

56.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read as MI record their most losses in a season?
56.article_body: MI registered their most defeats in an IPL season after losing their ninth match in IPL 2022, against KKR on Monday. MI are last on the table with four points and a net run-rate of -0.894. KKR jumped to the seventh position with 10 points. DC, SRH and PBKS are the other teams having 10 points each.

57.title: Kieron Pollard accidentally hits umpire with the ball while bowling, video goes viral
57.article_body: MI all-rounder Kieron Pollard accidentally hit on-field umpire Chris Gaffaney with the ball while bowling during his team's match against KKR. While Pollard was about to bowl the fifth delivery in KKR's 10th over, the ball slipped out of his hands and hit the umpire. "When you're throwing chalk at your friend, but it hits the teacher," a user tweeted.

58.title: Journalist Danish who was killed in Afghanistan wins Pulitzer for covering COVID in India
58.article_body: Indian photojournalist Danish Siddiqui who was killed while covering the war in Afghanistan last year has been posthumously awarded a Pulitzer Prize along with Adnan Abidi, Sanna Irshad Mattoo, and Amit Dave for coverage of COVID-19 in India. In 2018, Siddiqui was awarded a Pulitzer Prize for coverage of the Rohingya crisis.

59.title: FIR against AAP MLA for 'obstructing' Shaheen Bagh demolition drive
59.article_body: Delhi Police on Monday filed an FIR against Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA Amanatullah Khan for allegedly obstructing the anti-encroachment drive at Shaheen Bagh following a complaint by the South Delhi Municipal Corporation. "Khan and his supporters interfered in government duty at Shaheen Bagh," the police said. Protests erupted at Shaheen Bagh on Monday against the anti-encroachment drive.

60.title: Govt calls meeting with Uber, Ola amid rising consumer complaints
60.article_body: The Centre has called a meeting with cab aggregators Ola and Uber on Tuesday to discuss their policies after it received various complaints from consumers about their unfair trade practices, ride cancellation policy and surge pricing, among others. It will also seek information from them on how they calculate fares, cancellation charges and measures for consumer data protection.

61.title: Daddy showing who is the boss: Ravi Shastri on Bumrah's first-ever 5-wicket haul in IPL
61.article_body: After Jasprit Bumrah recorded his first-ever five-wicket haul in IPL, former India head coach Ravi Shastri tweeted, "Daddy showing who is the boss." He added, "Hope the young boys are watching. Class is permanent." Bumrah registered figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR, the best figures by any bowler in IPL 2022.

62.title: Apna chashma badal: Suniel Shetty to Twitter user who wrongly tagged him for tobacco ad
62.article_body: Suniel Shetty responded to a Twitter user who wrongly called him out over advertising tobacco. Tagging various actors, the person wrote, "Your kids have to feel shame on you to lead nation in wrong way." Suniel replied, "Bhai tu apna chashma adjust kar le ya badal de (Brother, adjust your glasses or change them)." The person later apologised to him.

63.title: Experience a new era of cooling with Carrier air conditioners: Carrier
63.article_body: Carrier announced that as the inventor of modern air conditioning, it has kept in sync with evolving consumer demands for energy-efficient room air conditioners with advanced features. The 2022 range of air conditioners includes personalized cooling on a single click with Flexicool 6-in-1, faster cooling with Insta Cool and easy access to features with Carrier Smart Connect, the company stated.

64.title: Amit Shah launches sale of Khadi products in 107 CAPF canteens
64.article_body: Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday launched the sale of khadi products in 107 Central Armed Police Force (CAPF) canteens. Shah, who's on a three-day tour of Assam, said khadi products will be made available in all paramilitary canteens across India soon. He had earlier made it mandatory for CAPF canteens to sell maximum "Swadeshi" products through Khadi and KVIC.

65.title: MP man fakes death after stealing ₹6.7 lakh, arrested after 9 months
65.article_body: A 34-year-old man, who allegedly faked his death to evade arrest in a theft case in MP's Chhatarpur district, has been caught after nine months. Sunil Namdeo had gone missing after collecting ₹6.65 lakh cash on behalf of a trader in July last year, police said. An unidentified body was later found which Namdeo's family identified as his.

66.title: Raj Police seize 1,300 kg silver & ₹56 lakh cash from bus, probe on
66.article_body: Police in Rajasthan's Dungarpur district on Sunday seized 1,321 kg of silver among other jewellery items along with ₹56 lakh in cash from a private bus while acting on a tip-off. The bus was going from Agra to Ahmedabad and the consignment had to be delivered at different places, police said, adding that the driver was unable to produce documents.

67.title: NCLT orders insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres
67.article_body: The National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) has ordered the initiation of insolvency proceedings against Birla Tyres in a case filed by multi-business chemicals firm SRF. As per SRF, Birla Tyres defaulted on payment of ₹15.84 crore for the supply of tyre cord fabric as of July 8, 2021. NCLT reprimanded Birla Tyres for taking a "casual attempt" to seek adjournments.

68.title: KKR keep their IPL 2022 playoffs hopes alive with 52-run victory against MI
68.article_body: KKR defeated MI by 52 runs in IPL 2022 on Monday to stay in the contention for a playoffs berth. With the win, KKR moved to the seventh spot from ninth spot on the points table. MI have now lost nine matches in the tournament. KKR will next face SRH on Saturday, while MI will next face CSK on Thursday.

69.title: Blast at Punjab Police Intelligence office in Mohali, pics showing damage surface
69.article_body: A blast was reported at the Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in Mohali late on Monday, officials said. Pictures released from the spot showed shattered doors and window panes. In a statement, the Punjab Police termed the explosion "minor", adding, "Senior officers are on the spot and an investigation is being done." A rocket-propelled grenade reportedly caused the blast.

70.title: Once a king, always a king: Harbhajan to Bumrah on his 5/10 vs KKR
70.article_body: Following MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah's five-wicket haul against KKR in IPL 2022, Harbhajan Singh tweeted, "Once a king, always a king. What a phenomenal spell by Bumrah." S Badrinath took to Twitter and wrote, "Form is temporary, class is permanent. Boom boom performance." Bumrah posted bowling figures of 4-1-10-5 to help restrict KKR to 165/9 in 20 overs.

71.title: Delhi sees less than 1,000 new COVID-19 cases, positivity rate at 4.94%
71.article_body: Delhi on Monday reported 799 new cases of COVID-19 and three deaths. The positivity rate in the city was reported at 4.94% as compared to 5.34% reported on Sunday. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours dropped to 5,369 from 5,939 on Sunday. Delhi recorded 1,422 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday and 1,407 cases on Saturday.

72.title: Pak politician's 3rd wife aged 18 files for divorce 4 months after marriage
72.article_body: Pakistani politician Aamir Liaquat's third wife Syeda Dania Shah said she has filed for divorce from the 49-year-old, calling him 'worse than devil', the local media reported. Shah, who is 18 years old, married Liaquat in February 2022. She has alleged that Liaquat beat her after getting intoxicated, while Liaquat denied the accusations.

73.title: He's gone better and better: Hesson on Hasaranga after his 5/18 vs SRH
73.article_body: Praising Wanindu Hasaranga following his 5/18 in RCB's 67-run win against SRH in IPL 2022, RCB Director of Cricket Operations Mike Hesson said the spinner has gone better and better as the tournament has progressed. "He...sort of packs a punch, he usually gets himself a lot of ground...generates a lot of power and a lot of leverage," he added.

74.title: Parts of Mumbai face power outages due to technical fault at Tata Power station
74.article_body: Power outages were reported in parts of Mumbai, including Bandra, Khar and Dharavi, after a transmission line tripped on Monday. The electricity supply was snapped due to a technical fault at Tata Power's receiving station located in Dharavi, as per information reportedly received from the Maharashtra Energy Department. The latest outages were reportedly faced by consumers of Adani Electricity.

75.title: I saw the Taj Mahal in 2007, it's truly a wonder of the world: Elon Musk
75.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk on Monday tweeted, "It's amazing. I visited in 2007 and also saw the Taj Mahal, which truly is a wonder of the world." Musk was responding to a tweet that claimed to show a facade from a fort in Agra. Several Indian Twitter users responded to Musk's tweet, asking, "Any plans to visit India soon?"

76.title: French court reduces sentence of ex-PM Fillon in embezzlement case
76.article_body: A French appeals court on Monday cut a year off the five-year jail term given to former Prime Minister François Fillon for embezzling public funds. Upholding Fillon's conviction, the court changed the sentence to four years in jail, three of them suspended. Notably, Fillon's jail term was not enforced while his appeal was pending.

77.title: Rohit's shocked reaction after his controversial DRS dismissal goes viral, fans react
77.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma was declared out by third umpire after KKR opted for DRS for a caught behind. A video of Rohit's shocked reaction went viral on social media as the UltraEdge showed a spike even before the ball passed the bat. "IPL should also include HotSpot," a fan tweeted. "Very very poor umpiring this season," another wrote.

78.title: Russian missiles hit Odessa during European Council Prez's visit
78.article_body: European Council President Charles Michel on Monday made a surprise visit to Odessa, during which he was forced to take cover as Russian missiles hit the Ukrainian port city. Describing his visit, Michel tweeted, "I saw silos full of grain, wheat and corn ready for export." "This badly needed food is stranded because of the Russian war," he added.

79.title: Terrorist hideout busted in J&K's Poonch, ammunition found
79.article_body: J&K Police along with other security forces have busted a terrorist hideout in the Poonch district, officials said.  The hideout was found by the forces while carrying out a joint search operation in the forest area of Dera Ki Gali on Monday following information about suspicious movement in the area.  Around 100 assorted rounds of ammunition were recovered, officials added.

80.title: 18-year-old attacked with sticks & iron rods in Haryana, probe on
80.article_body: A class 12 student was allegedly attacked by a group of around 14 persons with sticks and iron rods while he was at his father's shop in Haryana's Hisar. The 18-year-old victim is currently undergoing treatment for his injuries. An FIR has been registered, police said, adding that the exact reason behind the incident is yet to be ascertained.

81.title: I think Bollywood can't afford me, I don't want to waste my time: Mahesh Babu
81.article_body: Telugu cinema star Mahesh Babu on Monday said, "I always wanted to do Telugu films and wished people across India would watch it. And now when that is happening, I'm very happy." He added, "I may sound arrogant...I did get a lot of offers in Hindi. But I think they can't afford me. I don't want to waste my time."

82.title: Somaiya family NGO got donations from firms on ED, CBI radar: Raut
82.article_body: Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Monday said BJP leader Kirit Somaiya's Yuvak Pratishthan, an NGO run by his family, received donations worth crores from companies that were on ED, CBI, Income Tax department and SEBI's radar. "Is it a dirty game of turning black money to white?" Raut said. I will soon file complaint with investigative agencies, he added.

83.title: 98,000 quintals soybean worth ₹69 crore seized from MP factory
83.article_body: A joint investigation team of revenue and food departments seized 97,860 quintals of soybean worth over ₹69 crore from AV Agro Business Limited's factory in MP after conducting a surprise check. The action was taken as the company reportedly stocked soybean two-and-a-half times more than the prescribed limit. The seized stock was confiscated under provisions of the Essential Commodities Act.

84.title: 3 children drown while taking bath in Chambal river in MP's Morena
84.article_body: Three brothers, aged six, eight and 10, drowned while taking bath in the Chambal river in Madhya Pradesh's Morena district on Monday. The police were alerted by the family when the children failed to return for a long time following which a rescue operation was started. Their bodies were recovered later with the help of divers and locals.

85.title: Pope has postponed visit to Lebanon for health reasons: Minister
85.article_body: Pope Francis has postponed a planned visit to Lebanon that was scheduled for next month amid health concerns, Lebanese Minister Walid Nassar confirmed on Monday. Nassar added that a new date for the visit will be announced "as soon as it is determined". Pope Francis was recently spotted using a wheelchair in public owing to knee pain.

86.title: India beat Canada 5-0 to qualify for knockouts at 2022 Thomas Cup
86.article_body: India reached the knockout stage of 2022 Thomas Cup Finals after a 5-0 win against Canada in their Group C match in Bangkok on Monday. Notably, this is India's second successive win in the group. Ex-world number one Kidambi Srikanth gave India 1-0 lead followed by two doubles and two singles match wins. India will face Chinese Taipei on Wednesday.

87.title: Moderate to heavy rain, gusty winds likely in Bihar in next 2-3 days
87.article_body: Bihar is likely to witness moderate to heavy rain and gusty winds in the next two to three days as Cyclone Asani is intensifying in Odisha and Bengal, the Meteorological Centre said. North and south districts of Bihar may see heavy rain accompanied by thunderstorms. Parts of the state recorded light to moderate rain in the last 24 hours.

88.title: Pakistan imposes ban on export of sugar amid domestic demand
88.article_body: Pakistan has imposed a complete ban on the export of sugar owing to domestic demand for the commodity, PM Shehbaz Sharif said on Monday. "There will be...strict action against smuggling and hoarding [of sugar]. Absolutely zero tolerance [will be shown] for those found negligent in their duties," Sharif tweeted. Consumers in Pakistan's Punjab have reportedly complained of shortage of sugar.

89.title: LIC IPO shares to be allocated on May 12, listing on May 17
89.article_body: Bidders in LIC IPO will be allocated shares on May 12, Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey has said. He added that LIC will be listed on stock exchanges on May 17. The IPO, which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, received 47.83 crore bids against 16.2 crore shares on offer.

90.title: Ancestral home of Lankan Prez Rajapaksa's family set on fire, video surfaces
90.article_body: The ancestral home of ex-Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa and his brother President Gotabaya Rajapaksa was set ablaze on Monday by anti-government protesters amid an economic crisis. Videos and pictures of the vandalised property in Hambantota were also shared online. Mahinda Rajapaksa resigned as PM today amid violent clashes and protests across the country.

91.title: 11 fishermen stranded in Odisha sea airlifted to safety following CM's order
91.article_body: Eleven fishermen, who were stranded in the Sonepur sea in Odisha's Ganjam district on Monday, were successfully airlifted and taken to their native places safely, following CM Naveen Patnaik's prompt direction. The fishermen were stranded in the sea when they ventured into the waters for fishing activities. The boat ferrying them had faced some technical glitches, as per reports.

92.title: Strict action against those found guilty of Bihar PSC paper leak: CM
92.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar on Monday said that strict action will be taken against those found guilty of the Bihar Public Service Commission question paper leak. "The question paper leak of the BPSC examination is a matter of serious concern. I have asked senior officials to complete the probe at the earliest," said Kumar.

93.title: Manage economy, not media headlines: Rahul to PM as rupee plummets
93.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Monday asked PM Narendra Modi to focus on managing the economy not media headlines as the rupee slumped to an all-time low against the US dollar. PM Modi criticised former PM Manmohan Singh whenever the rupee fell, Rahul tweeted. The Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday.

94.title: Mexico to hire 500 doctors from Cuba amid a shortage: Prez Obrador
94.article_body: During a visit to Cuba, Mexican President Andrés Manuel López Obrador on Monday said that Mexico will hire 500 Cuban doctors as part of an effort to help make up for a shortage of medical professionals. Obrador met Cuban President Miguel Díaz-Canel and ex-President Raul Castro during the visit. Mexico will also purchase COVID-19 vaccines from Cuba, he added.

95.title: Imported EV cells may not be suitable for Indian conditions: NITI Aayog member
95.article_body: Battery cells imported for electric vehicles (EVs) may not be suitable for Indian conditions, NITI Aayog Member VK Saraswat said after multiple incidents of EVs catching fire were reported from across the country. "We should make sure that whatever cells we manufacture are suitable for Indian conditions of high temperature," Saraswat said. We must rigorously test imported cells, he added.

96.title: Next census to be e-census, will shape policies of next 25 yrs: Shah
96.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Monday said that the next population census that will take place in the country will be an e-census "which will shape policies of the next 25 years". Shah further said that the names of citizens will be added to the electoral roll once they turn 18 and will be automatically deleted if someone dies.

97.title: Saudi Arabia aims to welcome 7 crore tourists this year: Official
97.article_body: Saudi Arabia aims to welcome over 7 crore tourists this year, a tourism official said on Monday. In recent years, the kingdom has started to promote leisure travel as part of a strategy aimed at diversifying the economy away from oil, according to Reuters. The country was visited by around 6.2 crore tourists in 2021.

98.title: U2's Bono, The Edge perform at bomb shelter in Ukraine's Kyiv
98.article_body: Irish band U2's members Bono and The Edge performed at a bomb shelter in Ukraine's Kyiv after being invited by President Volodymyr Zelenskyy amid the Russian invasion. The duo performed for 40 minutes at the Khreshchatyk metro station to show their solidarity to Ukraine. The performance was attended by about 100 people including members of Ukraine's armed forces in uniforms.

99.title: I want to keep on improving like Federer, Nadal, Djokovic: Alcaraz
99.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz, who recently won tour-leading fourth title of the year at Madrid Open, said he looks up to Roger Federer, Rafael Nadal and Novak Djokovic as they don't stop improving. "I want to keep on progressing. I have really good shots...but I know that I can improve them and they can be even better," he added.

100.title: Most constructive time spent: Sidhu after meeting Punjab CM Mann
100.article_body: Congress' Navjot Singh Sidhu reacted to his meeting with Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann calling it "most constructive 50 minutes spent", adding that Mann was "very receptive". "We spoke about law and order, financial emergency, drug problem and...nexus between drug smugglers and...police," he added. Notably, this comes days after AICC incharge of Punjab recommended disciplinary action against Sidhu.

101.title: AMU prof booked for dowry harassment, saying triple talaq on road
101.article_body: A case has been registered against an assistant professor at Aligarh Muslim University for dowry harassment and for pronouncing triple talaq on the road. He refused to allow her to pursue MTech and demanded ₹10 lakh as dowry, the woman said in her police complaint. The woman filed a case in court for domestic violence, dowry harassment on March 30.

102.title: 2, including toddler, burnt alive as car catches fire after collision in Rajasthan
102.article_body: Two people, including a toddler, were charred to death and two others of the same family suffered critical burn injuries after the car they were travelling in hit a culvert and caught fire in Rajasthan's Baran on Monday. The incident took place when the family was returning home in Kota after attending an engagement ceremony.

103.title: Russian satellite TV shows 'You've blood on your hands from Ukrainians' message
103.article_body: Russian satellite TV menus were altered to show viewers messages about the war in Ukraine, according to screenshots obtained by Reuters. "You have the blood of thousands of Ukrainians and hundreds of dead children on your hands," a slogan read. The incident took place on Victory Day, when Russia celebrated the 77th anniversary of Soviet Union's victory over Nazi Germany.

104.title: OTT is huge but hard to say if OTT actors are stars: Sudhanshu Pandey
104.article_body: Actor Sudhanshu Pandey has stated that there's no doubt OTT is huge and gives visibility to many actors who are now getting their due. However, it is hard to say whether OTT actors are becoming stars or not, he added. Sudhanshu further said that the television medium grew so much that TV stars are now as big as film stars.

105.title: Jasprit Bumrah records best bowling figures of IPL 2022
105.article_body: MI fast bowler Jasprit Bumrah on Monday recorded the best bowling figures of IPL 2022 so far. The 28-year-old registered figures of 4-1-10-5 against KKR. The previous best bowling figures in IPL 2022 were recorded by RCB leg-spinner Wanindu Hasaranga, who had taken five wickets for 18 runs against SRH. Bumrah has now taken 10 wickets in IPL 2022.

106.title: DGCA forms fact-finding team as differently-abled child barred from flight
106.article_body: A three-member team has been formed by the DGCA to conduct a fact-finding enquiry into the matter wherein IndiGo denied boarding to a differently-abled child at the Ranchi airport, officials said. The team will also go to Ranchi and Hyderabad for the investigations. "Based on the outcome of the said enquiry, further action shall entail," DGCA said.

107.title: Produce tickets, passports to reach airport: Sri Lankan Airlines amid curfew
107.article_body: Sri Lankan Airlines on Monday urged passengers to produce their tickets and passports at checkpoints to reach airport in Colombo after nationwide curfew was imposed earlier today. The government has also deployed army in Colombo after clashes between pro and anti-government protesters broke out in the city. At least two people died and 130 others were injured due to clashes.

108.title: Fire on 14th floor of building near Shah Rukh's 'Mannat' in Mumbai, pics surface
108.article_body: A level-2 fire has broken out on the 14th floor of a highrise building near actor Shah Rukh Khan's house 'Mannat' in Bandra's Bandstand in Mumbai. Eight fire tenders have reached the spot, officials said, adding that no casualties have been reported yet. The fire reportedly broke out at around 7.45 pm on Monday.

109.title: SpiceJet flight from Belgavi lands safely at Delhi airport after being hit by bird
109.article_body: A SpiceJet flight from Karnataka's Belgavi to Delhi, which was hit by a bird on Monday, later landed safely at Delhi airport. According to an airline official at Indira Gandhi International Airport, the Boeing 737-8 MAX aircraft had around 187 passengers onboard at the time of the incident. "The engine blade is damaged," SpiceJet's Duty Manager at the airport said.

110.title: Israel arrests 65-yr-old suspected of sending threats to PM's Family
110.article_body: A 65-year-old woman was arrested by the Israeli Police on Monday for allegedly sending death threats with bullets to the family of Israel's PM Naftali Bennett. The police only identified the woman as a resident of southern Israel and refused to reveal any further details under a court-issued gag order. The death threats were sent to the family last month.

111.title: Punjab CM offers ₹50 lakh to family of deceased COVID-19 warrior
111.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday directed the state Finance Department to pay ₹50 lakh compensation to COVID-19 warrior Manjit Singh's family. Singh, a PRTC bus driver, had died of heart attack while bringing back stranded pilgrims from Maharashtra's Hazur Sahib during the 2020 lockdown. Notably, AAP had sought ₹50 lakh compensation from the previous Congress government at the time.

112.title: Valuations are temporary, values are forever: OYO Founder
112.article_body: OYO Founder and Group CEO Ritesh Agarwal, while commenting on India crossing the 100-unicorn mark, tweeted, "Founders should remember that valuations are temporary, values are forever. Focus on doing good and stay grounded." He added that this "milestone" will lay the path for the next 1000 unicorns. "I'm bullish on Indian entrepreneurs taking the world by storm," Agarwal further wrote.

113.title: Family kills woman for dowry, tries to pass it off as suicide in UP
113.article_body: A 28-year-old woman was allegedly killed by her husband and in-laws for dowry in UP’s Muzaffarnagar, police said on Monday. She was found hanging in her room, but her brother stated that the accused killed the woman and then hung her body to pass it off as suicide, police added. Another accused is absconding, police further said.

114.title: Bangladesh extends repayment schedule of loans to Sri Lanka by 1 yr
114.article_body: Bangladesh has decided to extend the repayment schedule of loans given to Sri Lanka by one more year. Bangladesh had provided $200 million in loans to Sri Lanka under a currency swap facility in May last year. Notably, the loans were originally due to be repaid in three months, but the term was extended several times at Sri Lanka's request.

115.title: CBI books former staff member of TMC MLA Babul Supriyo in corruption case
115.article_body: The Central Bureau of Investigation (CBI) has booked a former staff member of TMC MLA and former Union Minister Babul Supriyo, along with top executives of Engineering Projects (India) Ltd, in an alleged corruption case. The CBI has alleged that Sushanta Mullick, who was Supriyo's employee, received ₹5 lakh in his account to favour a private company in December 2016.

116.title: UGC seeks report from university on 'Nazism & Hindu RW' exam question
116.article_body: The University Grants Commission (UGC) has sought a report from Greater Noida-based Sharda University on an exam question asking about similarities between Nazism and Hindu right-wing. "Asking students such a question is against the spirit and ethos of our country," UGC said. It asked the university to explain the steps taken by it to ensure such incidents don't happen again.

117.title: PFI is dangerous, should be banned soon: Assam Assembly Dy Speaker
117.article_body: Assam Legislative Assembly Deputy Speaker Numal Momin on Monday called the Popular Front of India (PFI) a "dangerous" organisation, demanding that it should be immediately banned. "[PFI's] planning towards Northeast, particularly Assam, is not very good," he added. Momin further stated that several people linked with the PFI were arrested during the anti-CAA protests in the state.

118.title: Toyota to invest ₹4,800 cr in Karnataka, will create 3,500 jobs
118.article_body: The Toyota Group has signed an MoU with the Karnataka government for a ₹4,800 crore investment in the state. As per the company's statement, the investment aims to promote green technology and set up local manufacturing facilities to build electric powertrain parts and components. The move will generate around 3,500 direct jobs, said Toyota Kirloskar Motor's Executive VP Vikram Gulati.

119.title: Sweden's ruling party to announce NATO membership stance on May 15
119.article_body: Sweden's ruling Social Democrats on Monday said that the party would announce on May 15 its position on whether the country should apply for a NATO membership. Notably, the Finnish ruling party, Social Democrats, are also expected to announce their position on Finland's NATO membership this week. Finland and Sweden are reconsidering their positions on joining NATO amid Russia-Ukraine conflict.

120.title: Rupee closes at all-time low of 77.50 against US dollar
120.article_body: The Indian rupee weakened further on Monday to close at a new all-time low of 77.50 against the US dollar, 60 paise over its previous close. During the trading session, the rupee touched its lifetime low of 77.52. The currency was weighed down by elevated crude oil prices and a widening trade deficit.

121.title: Nimrat Kaur shares pic of tattoo, says got it for mom with sister
121.article_body: Actress Nimrat Kaur shared a series of pictures on Instagram showing off her wrist tattoo on Sunday to mark Mother's Day. The actress wrote that she got the tattoo along with her sister Ruby five years ago to celebrate their bond with their mother. "The idea of an infinity knot symbolising Mama...protecting me and Ruby with her love," Nimrat wrote.

122.title: Singapore to ban 'The Kashmir Files', says 'it may disrupt religious harmony'
122.article_body: Singapore will ban the Hindi Bollywood movie 'The Kashmir Files' as it has been assessed to be "beyond" the city-state's film classification guidelines, authorities told Channel News Asia. It has been refused classification due to its "provocative and one-sided portrayal" of the 1990 Kashmiri Hindu exodus, they said. It has the "potential to...disrupt social...and religious harmony", they added.

123.title: KKR's management is to blame for their performances in IPL 2022: Kaif
123.article_body: Talking about KKR, who are currently placed ninth in the IPL 2022 standings, Mohammad Kaif said the KKR management is to blame for their current situation as they have done a lot of "chopping and changing". He added that too many changes added pressure on the players and it became difficult for them to play in that environment.

124.title: He's done right thing: Neetu on Ranbir not being on social media
124.article_body: Actress Neetu Kapoor has said that her son Ranbir Kapoor has done the right thing by not being on any social media platforms. Neetu further said that earlier fans had a craze for celebrities and their personal lives and the urge to see them onscreen was high. Now actors post regular updates and have become way more accessible, she added.

125.title: AAP govt in Punjab working undemocratically: Ex-Deputy CM of UP
125.article_body: The AAP government in Punjab is working in an "undemocratic manner" and "not following due legal process", former UP Deputy CM Dinesh Sharma said commenting on Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga's arrest last week. "Wherever there is the BJP government, work is being done in all areas for development, including education, health and security," he said.

126.title: Deeply distressed with rumour mongering: Axis AMC Founder CEO on alleged scam
126.article_body: Axis Asset Management Company (AMC) Founder CEO Rajiv Anand on Monday said he is deeply depressed with rumour mongering regarding allegations that two of fund managers (FMs) at Axis Mutual Fund have been removed from their positions for front-running. "If there is a problem, we will address it. Do not malign the reputations of the highly skilled professionals," Anand said.

127.title: LIC's public issue has been successful: DIPAM Secretary
127.article_body: Department of Investment and Public Asset Management (DIPAM) Secretary Tuhin Kanta Pandey on Monday said the LIC's IPO offer "has met with tremendous success". The LIC IPO, which started on May 4, has been closed today after being oversubscribed 2.95 times. While the policyholder position has been subscribed 6.11 times, the employees portion has been subscribed 4.39 times.

128.title: Properties worth ₹67 cr belonging to gangster Vikas Dubey seized in UP
128.article_body: Over a dozen properties worth ₹67 crore belonging to gangster Vikas Dubey, killed in a police encounter in Uttar Pradesh's Kanpur in July 2020, were attached on Monday. The properties were allegedly earned through illegal means. The properties were located in Kanpur, Kanpur Dehat and Lucknow, District Magistrate Neha Sharma said.

129.title: This young hero will become a superhero for MI: Irfan on Tilak Varma
129.article_body: Praising Tilak Varma, ex-India cricketer Harbhajan Singh said the MI batter is like an "investment" for the franchise. Ex-India all-rounder Irfan Pathan lauded the 19-year-old batter, saying this "young hero will become a superhero" for MI if he continues to play like he's playing in the ongoing IPL. Tilak has scored 328 runs from 10 matches so far.

130.title: Humans will land on Mars within this decade: SpaceX President
130.article_body: SpaceX President and COO Gwynne Shotwell told CNBC that SpaceX will likely land humans on Mars before the end of the 2020s. "I think it'll be in this decade, yes. People on the moon, sooner," Shotwell said. She added, "We need to get a large delivery to the surface of Mars, and then people will start thinking harder about it."

131.title: Mobs set fire to Sri Lankan MP, minister's houses amid crisis; videos surface
131.article_body: Houses of members of Sri Lanka's ruling party were set on fire on Monday as violent protests erupted after PM Mahinda Rajapaksa stepped down amid the country's worst economic crisis. Videos showed the houses of MP Sanath Nishantha and minister Ramesh Pathirana engulfed by fires. This came after Rajapaksa supporters clashed with anti-government protesters, wounding hundreds.

132.title: Dileep's wife questioned by Kerala Police in actress abduction case
132.article_body: Malayalam actor Dileep's wife Kavya Madhavan was questioned by Kerala Police on Monday in connection with the Malayalam actress' abduction and assault case. Dileep is the co-accused in the case. Kavya is the only witness and was served a notice by the probe team to appear earlier. She had refused, saying it should be held at place which she wishes.

133.title: Punjab CM directs police force to launch major crackdown on drug peddlers
133.article_body: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann on Monday directed the state police force to launch a major crackdown on drug peddlers and tighten the noose around any political functionary interfering with its anti-drug campaign. He added that neither political persons nor officers would be spared, if found conniving with the drug mafia. "All of you should work fearlessly," Mann told police personnel.

134.title: UN agency chief resigns amid probe into investments
134.article_body: Grete Faremo, the Executive Director of the United Nations Office for Project Services (UNOPS), resigned from her post amid a probe into investments made by the UN agency. The resignation comes after a news report claimed the UNOPS made "a baffling series of financial decisions" that purportedly led to $25 million in losses. Faremo had led the UNOPS since 2014.

135.title: India's biggest IPO of LIC subscribed nearly 3 times on final day of bidding
135.article_body: LIC's IPO, India's biggest IPO which opened on May 4 and closed on May 9, was subscribed 2.95 times on Monday. Expected to raise ₹20,557 crore, the IPO received bids for 47.83 crore equity shares against the IPO size of 16.2 crore shares. The policyholders' portion was subscribed 6.11 times, employees bid 4.39 times and retail investors bid 1.99 times.

136.title: Pak to tour Sri Lanka for just 2 Tests, ODIs removed on SLC's request
136.article_body: Pakistan will play only a two-match Test series during their tour of Sri Lanka in the month of July-August as the three-match ODI series has been cancelled as per requests from Sri Lanka cricket board. Final dates are yet to be announced. While Test series is part of World Test Championship 2021-23, ODIs weren't included in World Cup Super League.

137.title: Cong has been good to all, time to repay that debt in full: Sonia at party meet
137.article_body: At a meeting of the Congress Working Committee on Monday, party chief Sonia Gandhi said, "Congress has been good to all, (it's) time to repay that debt in full." In an apparent reference to the dissident G-23 leaders in Congress, she said, "Self-criticism is needed in...but (it) shouldn't be done in a manner that self-confidence and morale are eroded."

138.title: Russian envoy doused with red paint by anti-war protesters in Poland
138.article_body: Russia's Ambassador to Poland Sergey Andreev was doused with red paint by people in Poland's Warsaw who were protesting against Ukraine's invasion on Monday. Protesters were seen carrying Ukraine's flag and chanting "fascists" in videos that surfaced online. Andreev was visiting a Soviet Military Cemetery to mark 77th anniversary of the end of World War 2 when he was attacked.

139.title: Andhra software engineer shoots colleague dead at her wedding venue, kills self
139.article_body: A software engineer killed his female colleague, who was about to get married, before shooting himself in Andhra Pradesh's Nellore district on Monday. Police said the duo was in a relationship for three years and the woman's family had rejected the accused's proposal to marry their daughter. The accused allegedly gatecrashed the wedding venue and shot the woman dead.

140.title: Neighbour throws acid on family sleeping on roof in UP's Agra, 4 injured
140.article_body: A man has been booked for allegedly injuring four family members by throwing acid on them when they were sleeping on the roof of their house in Uttar Pradesh's Agra. Prima facie, it seems to be an outcome of a family dispute, Agra SSP said. A few drops of acid were reportedly found on the accused neighbour's roof, he added.

141.title: Aayush Sharma refutes reports of grandfather's death, says 'he's fighting'
141.article_body: Actor Aayush Sharma refuted reports of his politician grandfather Pandit Sukh Ram's death saying, "[He is] fighting back bravely." Sharma said, "In this testing time for our entire family, I kindly request everyone to pray for his well-being and refrain the media from paying heed to any false news." The ex-Telecom Minister was hospitalised following a brain stroke.

142.title: MI to bowl first against KKR; MI make 1 change, KKR make 5 changes
142.article_body: MI captain Rohit Sharma won the toss and elected to bowl first against KKR in their IPL 2022 match on Monday. MI have made one change to their playing XI, with injured Suryakumar Yadav being replaced by Ramandeep Singh. Meanwhile, KKR have included Ajinkya Rahane, Venkatesh Iyer, Sheldon Jackson, Pat Cummins and Varun Chakaravarthy in their playing XI.

143.title: Unrealistic beauty standards, filters can be toxic: Paris Hilton
143.article_body: American media personality Paris Hilton has said that the unrealistic beauty standards and filters on social media "can be very toxic". "I can't imagine being 12, 13-years-old and seeing these beauty standards that are not real and using the filters all the time," Paris added. She further said that it's not really good for someone's mind at that age.

144.title: TN woman cooks on road as house demolished in anti-encroachment drive
144.article_body: A woman in Chennai started cooking food on the road after her house was demolished during an anti-encroachment drive. The woman said she has documents of her house and it was demolished without any information. "I started cooking here on the streets as I have nowhere to go," she added.

145.title: Man installs saffron flag at Chhattisgarh royal family's palace, arrested
145.article_body: A man was arrested on Monday for allegedly stealing a "traditional flag" from the palace of a royal family in Chhattisgarh's Raigarh and replacing it with a saffron one. The person confessed to the crime and claimed he was mentally unstable, police said. "It is possible that [the act] could be a political message," a member of the family said.

146.title: Bengaluru to host mega metaverse summit from May 14 to 15
146.article_body: Bengaluru will host a mega metaverse summit named 'NamasteyNFT Bengaluru 2022' from May 14 to 15 at the International Exhibition Centre. It is likely to host more than 300 artists and 20 speakers like Vineet Vohra, Fikret Dilek Uyar and Jassi Oberai. Over 10,000 participants from across the country are expected to take part in the event.

147.title: Education, health startups can be game changers for India: Prez
147.article_body: President Ram Nath Kovind has said the foray of startups into the "unexplored territories" like education and health "can be the game changer" for India. "It can be a combination of job provider and revenue earner for our people," President Kovind said. He added, "The stories of various...start-ups...slated to be worth more than one billion have scripted new history."

148.title: Suryakumar Yadav ruled out of remaining IPL 2022 matches
148.article_body: MI batter Suryakumar Yadav has been ruled out of the remaining matches of IPL 2022 owing to a left forearm muscle injury. He had sustained the injury during MI's match against GT on May 6. Suryakumar played 8 matches for MI this season, scoring 303 runs at an average of 43.29, including three half centuries.

149.title: Firecracker explosion triggers fire near BJP leaders at Noida event
149.article_body: A firecracker exploded and triggered a small fire in a tent under which BJP leaders were seated on a stage during an event in Greater Noida, prompting the local police to launch a probe. The police had asked organisers not to burst firecrackers, but they didn't listen to them, said Additional Deputy Commissioner of Police (Greater Noida) Vishal Pandey.

150.title: Adani Airports raises $250 million for airports development
150.article_body: Adani Airports has raised $250 million funding from a consortium of Standard Chartered and Barclays Bank with an option to raise another $200 million. The funds raised will be used to scale up the airports business into "one of the largest airport platforms globally," a spokesperson said. Adani Airports manages airports in Mumbai, Ahmedabad, Lucknow, Mangaluru and Jaipur, among others.

151.title: I'm okay with going to hell: Musk after 'If I die under mysterious circumstances' tweet
151.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk tweeted, "I'm ok with going to hell, if that is indeed my destination, since the vast majority of all humans ever born will be there." Musk's tweet came hours after he tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Musk's tweets sparked speculation about whether he was receiving threats from Russia.

152.title: Japan will cease to exist, Venice dying due to very low birth rates: Musk
152.article_body: The world's richest man Elon Musk recently tweeted, "At the risk of stating the obvious, unless something changes to cause the birth rate to exceed the death rate, Japan will eventually cease to exist." He added, "This would be a great loss for the world." In another tweet, Musk said, "Venice is slowly dying due to very low birth rates."

153.title: Cong, AAP leaders blocked bulldozers in Shaheen Bagh: Delhi BJP chief
153.article_body: Congress and AAP leaders blocked bulldozers during the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Monday, hindering government action, said Delhi BJP chief Adesh Gupta. In letters to Delhi Police and South Delhi Municipal Corporation Commissioners, Gupta said, "I request [the Commissioner] to take just action against [Congress and AAP] leaders for obstructing government work."

154.title: Dumper truck crashes into vehicles leading to oil spill in Thane, 1 injured
154.article_body: Two vehicles were hit by a dumper truck carrying debris on Majiwada Bridge in Thane on Monday. The accident led to an oil spill on the stretch. The driver of the dumper truck, who was trapped inside the vehicle, sustained minor injuries to his right leg. As per reports, he was rushed to a nearby hospital for treatment.

155.title: Russians will always remember India's role in defeating Nazis: Russian envoy
155.article_body: On the occasion of the 77th anniversary of the end of World War 2, Russian Ambassador to India Denis Alipov said, "Russians will always remember with gratitude the Indian contribution to the defeat of Nazi Germany." He added, "In 1941,1942 friendship societies were set up in India in support of USSR...Indian contingents were engaged in providing supplies to Red Army."

156.title: Local BJP leader shot dead over land dispute in Jharkhand
156.article_body: A local BJP leader was shot dead in his sleep in Jharkhand's Lohardaga district on Monday over a land dispute, police said. The deceased has been identified as Ratan Mahato, a BJP booth committee president. Two alleged assailants have been identified and a manhunt has been launched to arrest them, said officer-in-charge Anil Kumar.

157.title: Babar Azam is the best batter in world at the moment: Vettori
157.article_body: On being asked who is the best batter in the world right now, ex-New Zealand captain Daniel Vettori said, "Babar Azam is the most in-form batter on the back of his series against Australia." Babar was the second highest run-getter in Australia-Pakistan ODI series behind Imam-ul-Haq. The Pakistan captain is currently ranked number one in ICC ODI and T20I rankings.

158.title: Kejriwal to visit poll-bound Guj on May 11, will hold rally in Rajkot
158.article_body: AAP National Convener Arvind Kejriwal will visit poll-bound Gujarat on May 11 and address a rally in Rajkot on same day, party said. This will be Kejriwal's second visit to Gujarat in two weeks as he held rally with a Bharatiya Tribal Party (BTP) leader in Bharuch on May 1. AAP will contest Gujarat Assembly polls in alliance with BTP.

159.title: Sri Lankan ruling party MP found dead amid clashes: Police
159.article_body: A lawmaker from Sri Lanka's ruling party was found dead on Monday following a clash with anti-government protesters outside the capital Colombo, the police said. Amarakeerthi Athukorala opened fire and critically wounded two people blocking his car in Nittambuwa, they added. Athukorala was found dead after trying to take refuge in a nearby building, they further said.

160.title: Kids don't care: Kunal on Taimur being trolled for refusing pics
160.article_body: Actor Kunal Kemmu has reacted to Saif Ali Khan's son Taimur being trolled for asking journalists to stop clicking his pictures, saying, "Kids don't care...they don't have to be diplomatic." Kunal further said, "But I think it's also the people who sit there wanting to comment on this, they need to change." Kunal is Saif's sister Soha Ali Khan's husband.

161.title: Delhi to witness fresh spell of heatwave for next 3 days: IMD
161.article_body: Delhi and its adjoining areas are likely to witness a fresh spell of a heatwave for the next three days, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Monday. The temperature may reach 43°C to 44°C on May 11 and 12. "The April like situation [of heatwave] will not be there in May," said a senior scientist of IMD.

162.title: Over 73% of work on Mumbai Metro Line 3 completed: MMRC
162.article_body: Mumbai Metro Rail Corporation (MMRC) said that over 73% of the work on Line 3 has been completed. Over 82% of the work on stations has also been completed, it added. "The project is running behind the schedule. I have made a catch-up plan to ensure that the project is completed...as per the revised timeline," Metropolitan Commissioner SVR Srinivas said.

163.title: Bulldozers will run at Delhi's New Friends Colony on Tuesday: SDMC
163.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation (SDMC) Central Zone Chairman Rajpal on Monday said illegal encroachments will be removed in New Friends Colony from 11:00 am on Tuesday. "Bulldozers of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi will be running tomorrow as well," Rajpal said. This comes after SDMC's anti-encroachment drive in Shaheen Bagh was halted due to protests on Monday.

164.title: Maha MP Navneet Rana, husband to approach PM against ill-treatment in jail
164.article_body: Maharashtra MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana on Monday said they will approach PM Narendra Modi and Home Minister Amit Shah to raise the issue of their alleged ill-treatment by Maharashtra authorities when they were in jail recently. "We had filed a complaint against it here, but no action was taken," Navneet said.

165.title: Will file FIR against ‘popat’ Raut who said he'll bury me: Rana
165.article_body: Amravati MP Navneet Rana on Monday called Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut a 'popat' and said that she will file an FIR against him for threatening to bury her 20-feet deep. Navneet Rana on Sunday challenged Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray to contest an election against her, adding that Lord Ram will teach Shiv Sena a lesson in civic polls.

166.title: Sky turns blood-red due to rare light phenomenon in China, pics surface
166.article_body: Pictures and videos from a Chinese city showed the sky taking on a blood-red hue due to a rare phenomenon. The sky in Zhoushan turned red on Saturday (May 7) causing panic, after which meteorological experts issued an explanation. The refraction and scattering of light from fishing boats due to more water in the atmosphere led to the colour change.

167.title: 'Prithviraj' educational film, should be shown in schools: Akshay
167.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking at the trailer launch of 'Prithviraj' on Monday, called it an educational film, adding that there's only a paragraph about the warrior in history books. The actor further requested the government to screen the film in schools as a mandatory event so children are told about Indian history. "I want every child to watch it," Akshay added.

168.title: U'khand CM Dhami files nomination papers for Champawat bypoll
168.article_body: Uttarakhand CM Pushkar Singh Dhami filed his nomination papers on Monday for the upcoming Assembly bypoll for Champawat constituency. Dhami will face Congress leader Nirmala Gahtori in bypoll that is slated to be held on May 31. Ex-BJP MLA Kailash Chandra Gahtori vacated the seat for Dhami after latter lost to Congress' Bhuwan Kapri from Khatima in Uttarakhand Assembly polls.

169.title: Largest passenger elevator, as big as a room, installed at Mumbai's Jio World Centre
169.article_body: KONE Elevator India installed a 25.78 square metre elevator at Mumbai's Jio World Centre and claims that it's the world's largest passenger elevator. The 16-tonne elevator, supported by 18 pulleys and nine ropes for safety, is "as big as a room" and has a four-panel centre opening door and glass walls. It can reportedly carry 200 people at one time.

170.title: Patiala clash main conspirator Barjinder Parwana sent to 14-day judicial custody
170.article_body: The alleged mastermind and main conspirator behind the recent violent clashes in Punjab's Patiala, Barjinder Singh Parwana, has been remanded to a 14-day judicial custody . This comes days after clashes broke out between two groups during an anti-Khalistan protest by Shiv Sena. So far, six people have been arrested in connection with the case.

171.title: Indian women's team beat Canada in their Thomas and Uber Cup opener
171.article_body: Indian women's badminton team beat Canada 4-1 in their opener in Group D at Thomas and Uber Cup Finals in Bangkok on Sunday. Two-time Olympic medallist PV Sindhu gave India 1-0 lead before Canada levelled it 1-1 following Shruti Mishra and Simran Singhi's loss in their doubles match. Later, India won their one doubles and two singles matches.

172.title: Twitter user asks question using 'Munna Bhai...' meme, Pune Police replies
172.article_body: Pune Police chief Amitabh Gupta held a question and answer session on Twitter on Monday. When a person asked him if it was necessary for a traffic police constable to take keys if one mistakenly jumps a signal, he replied, "Is it necessary to break the signal?." The Twitter user had used a meme from the movie 'Munna Bhai MBBS'.

173.title: Ukraine President Zelenskyy's fleece jacket sold for ₹86 lakh in London fundraiser
173.article_body: Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's fleece jacket, signed by him, was auctioned for £90,000 (₹86,04,680) at a fundraiser for Ukraine in London. According to Ukraine's Embassy to the UK, the goal of the fundraiser, titled 'Brave Ukraine', was to "tell the stories of (Ukraine's) bravery which became iconic during the war, as well as to raise funds to support this bravery."

174.title: You don't need top education to build a company in India: Billionaire Watsa
174.article_body: Canadian billionaire businessman Prem Watsa said he's optimistic about India's startup industry as it's providing opportunity to the "common person". "[India] provides an opportunity...[to] someone who may not have gone to the best schools and universities but has the ability to build a company," Watsa stated. He added, "You got a 100 unicorns...and you'll have a ton more in India."

175.title: We begged them to not beat him up: MP lynching victim's daughter-in-law
175.article_body: Daughter-in-law of Dhansha who was killed on suspicion of cow slaughter a few days ago, said that she saw 20 men beating Dhansha up with sticks and rods. "He was first dragged out of his cot as he was sleeping. When we heard the noise, we came out of the house...We begged them to not beat him up," she added.

176.title: Bihar man gets life imprisonment for abducting, killing 6-yr-old step son
176.article_body: A session's court sentenced rigorous life imprisonment to a man for kidnapping and killing his six-year-old step son in Bihar's Bhabua.
