The court also imposed a penalty of ₹15,000 and an additional six months imprisonment if the accused failed to deposit the amount. The accused's wife was not staying with him as she was allegedly subjected to domestic violence.

177.title: No problem with action if he's wrong: Rajasthan minister on rape case against son
177.article_body: Rajasthan minister Mahesh Joshi, whose son Rohit Joshi has been accused of raping a 23-year-old woman over several months, has called for a strict probe into the matter and said he will "always stand with the truth and justice". "If my son has done anything wrong, I would not have any problem if action is taken against him," Mahesh added.

178.title: Over 70 injured after Sri Lankan Prez's supporters clash with protesters
178.article_body: At least 78 people were injured after clashes broke out between Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's supporters and anti-government protesters in Colombo on Monday, AFP reported. Police fired tear gas and water cannons to disperse the crowd, following which, an indefinite nationwide curfew was imposed in the country. Notably, Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has tendered his resignation.

179.title: I hope Man Utd continue to stick with Ronaldo: Beckham
179.article_body: Amid calls for reforms at Manchester United ahead of the next season, former English footballer David Beckham hopes that the five-time Ballon d'Or winner Cristiano Ronaldo remains in the club's plans. "It's important to him...we all know how much United means to him. He's still doing what he does best...so hopefully it continues for another year or two," Beckham said.

180.title: OYO to buy Direct Booker for ₹40 cr to expand footprint in Europe
180.article_body: OYO has agreed to buy Europe-based vacation rental firm Direct Booker for over ₹40 crore with the aim of expanding OYO's footprint in Europe, the company said in a statement. OYO added that it intends to "actively scout" for "tuck-in" acquisitions, especially in the European market. The firm already has nearly 9,000 homes on its Belvilla and Traum Ferienwohnungen platforms.

181.title: 17-year-old boy builds 'mind-controlled' robotic arm in US, pic surfaces
181.article_body: A 17-year-old from Virginia in the US has invented a robotic prosthetic arm that can be controlled by the mind. Benjamin Choi used his sister's 3-D printer and some fishing line to print individual parts of the arm and then bolted them all together. It uses an artificial intelligence (AI) algorithm to interpret the user's brain waves.

182.title: People taunted me for not getting pregnant, tried IVF: Sambhavna
182.article_body: Actress Sambhavna Seth has revealed that she has been taunted and age-shamed for not being able to get pregnant even after many years of marriage. Sambhavna and her husband Avinash Dwivedi got married in 2016. "IVF is one of the ways. Some people might know about it, some might not. We have tried it four times and failed," Sambhavna said.

183.title: 'KGF 2' screened in Seoul; first Kannada film to be showcased in South Korea
183.article_body: Yash starrer-'KGF: Chapter 2' had its screening in Seoul. It was the first Kannada film to be screened in South Korea along with its Hindi version. 'KGF: Chapter 2' was also the first Indian film to be screened post-pandemic. Several fans from India, Nepal, Bangladesh etc. attended the screening in large numbers. The action drama has received tremendous response worldwide.

184.title: 91-run win vs DC gives us lot of confidence: CSK all-rounder Moeen
184.article_body: After CSK's 91-run win over DC in IPL 2022, CSK all-rounder Moeen Ali said winning against a great side boosts the team's confidence going forward. "Any win at the moment is great for us," he added. Moeen posted bowling figures of 4-0-13-3. The defending champions are at the eighth spot on the points table with four wins in 11 matches.

185.title: 65-yr-old ex-Army man held for sexually assaulting 8-yr-old in WB
185.article_body: A 65-year-old ex-Army man was detained by police on Sunday for allegedly sexually assaulting an eight-year-old girl in West Bengal's Siliguri three months ago, an officer said. The matter came to light on Sunday as the girl's family members came to know about the alleged incident from her and a crowd gathered outside the home of the accused.

186.title: Pune Customs arrest woman for smuggling gold worth ₹26 lakh
186.article_body: Pune Customs officers arrested a 34-year-old woman passenger, who had flown in from Dubai for attempting to smuggle 500 grams of gold worth ₹26 lakh. The woman was trying to smuggle the gold in the form of crude bangles and chains, said a senior Customs officer. Police also arrested another woman who had come to receive her at the airport.

187.title: 6-yr-old boy finds megalodon shark tooth while looking for shells on UK beach
187.article_body: A six-year-old boy, Sammy Shelton found a three million-year-old megalodon shark tooth while looking for shells on a beach in the UK. The extinct megalodon was said to be 50 to 60 ft-long, three times the size of great white sharks. His father revealed that Sammy now sleeps with the tooth next to his bed.

188.title: Bus hangs from bridge after collision in Punjab; 2 dead, 17 injured
188.article_body: Two people were killed and about 17 others injured after a Haryana Roadways bus collided with a private bus in Punjab's Mohali, following which the former rammed into the railing and hung from a bridge. One of the deceased fell from the bus after the windshield broke as it hung from the bridge. The Haryana Roadways bus driver was booked.

189.title: Comedy is the nicest genre; it's difficult to make people laugh: Samantha
189.article_body: Actress Samantha Prabhu said that she wants to do more comedy films in the future. "The most difficult thing is to make people laugh. You can make people cry, you can make people sad, but to make people laugh is truly difficult and that is what I love doing," she added. "I feel comedy is the nicest genre," Samantha said.

190.title: I'm fortunate I got to work with Akshay sir: Manushi Chhillar on Prithviraj
190.article_body: When asked how it was working with Akshay Kumar in 'Prithviraj', former Miss World Manushi Chhillar said, "It's my first film so it'll always be special. I'm fortunate that I got to work with Akshay sir." "Yash Raj [Films] has launched me and [Dr Chandraprakash Dwivedi] directed my first film. So definitely 'Prithviraj' is very special to me," she added.

191.title: Will always stand with truth: Raj Minister on rape allegations against son
191.article_body: Rajasthan Minister Mahesh Joshi reacted to the allegations of rape against his son, Rohit Joshi, saying that he will always stand with truth and justice. "Police must conduct a strict and in-depth probe…Let the police do their work," Mahesh Joshi said. A 23-year-old woman from Jaipur alleged that Rohit raped her on multiple occasions over a year.

192.title: Actress Mohena Kumari Singh shares first glimpse of her newborn son
192.article_body: Actress-choreographer Mohena Kumari Singh took to Instagram on Sunday to share the first glimpse of her newborn son.  She also penned a poem for her son, which read, "Can't keep my joy at bay. Just happy to be a mum today. Having a celebration with my little one in 2022 on...8th of May and why not...it's my first Mother's Day."

193.title: I finished my work on 'Prithviraj' in just 42 days: Akshay Kumar
193.article_body: Akshay Kumar has revealed that he completed the shooting of his upcoming movie 'Prithviraj' in just 42 days. "Come on time and leave on time, then film completes on time," he added. "It was because of...pandemic that [it] got delayed, otherwise, [it] would've been released long back," said Akshay. 'Prithviraj' also stars Manushi Chhillar, Sonu Sood and Sanjay Dutt.

194.title: I was contemplating retiring out to get Dinesh Karthik in: Faf du Plessis
194.article_body: RCB captain Faf du Plessis has revealed that he was contemplating retiring out against SRH to get Dinesh Karthik in. Talking about Dinesh Karthik scoring 30*(8), Du Plessis said, "If Karthik keeps hitting sixes like that, everyone always wants to get him in and bat for as long as possible...He’s just so clear."

195.title: Uber will treat hiring as a 'privilege' to cut costs: CEO
195.article_body: Uber CEO Dara Khosrowshahi told employees in an e-mail that the company needs to cut costs, citing "the market is experiencing a seismic shift", CNBC reported. "We'll treat hiring as a privilege and be deliberate about when and where we add headcount," the CEO said. "We have to make sure our unit economics work before we go big," he added.

196.title: Pitch didn't suit pace bowling: Josh Hazlewood after win over SRH
196.article_body: After defeating SRH by 67 runs, RCB pacer Josh Hazlewood has said that the Wankhede Stadium's pitch didn't suit pace bowling. "The wicket probably got drier as the match went on. Being a day game, it deteriorated and we took the pace off. Our spinners bowled really well...Tonight's wicket didn't suit pace (bowling)," Hazlewood said.

197.title: Sometimes a break from the game is all you need: Vaughan on Kohli
197.article_body: Referring to Virat Kohli's form in the ongoing IPL season, former England captain Michael Vaughan said, "Sometimes a break from the game is all a player needs." He added, "The amount of cricket these players play, a break is as good as anything." Kohli has registered three golden ducks and has scored 216 runs in 12 games so far.

198.title: Instagram to support NFTs from Ethereum, Polygon, Solana: Report
198.article_body: Instagram is set to allow users to post and share their non-fungible tokens (NFTs) on the platform, CoinDesk reported. As per the report, Instagram is planning NFT integration with Ethereum, Polygon, Solana and Flow, which are the networks that host the majority of trading in NFTs. The pilot will reportedly feature a small group of US-based NFT enthusiasts.

199.title: Arjun Kapoor shares before-after pics showing his physical transformation
199.article_body: Actor Arjun Kapoor took to Instagram to share before-after pictures showing his physical transformation. He wrote, "15 months of being #workinprogress...I'm immensely proud of this journey. Feb 2021 to May 2022...it's been a tough one and I'm only glad that I could stay on track." He added, "I'm loving the state of mind...I'm in for these past 15 months."

200.title: Salman said I wasn't cut for B'wood, told me to try TV: Sidharth
200.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra has revealed that when he first met actor Salman Khan ahead of his debut, the former told him he wasn't cut out for Bollywood and should try his luck in TV. Sidharth made his debut in 2012 with 'Student of the Year'. Sidharth added Salman later said he made the comments to push him to do better.

201.title: BMC plans to build 'Democracy Square' near Azad Maidan in Mumbai
201.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Municipal Corporation (BMC) plans to build a 'Democracy Square' at a traffic island near Azad Maidan off MG Road in South Mumbai. The project will cost around ₹50,000 and will be funded by Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's local area development funds. "The idea was conceptualised by...CM and its aim is to honour our democracy," an official said.

202.title: Man hits elder brother with iron rod on head, kills him in Kerala; held
202.article_body: A 42-year-old man killed his elder brother by hitting him on the head with an iron rod in Kerala. Police said that the two used to fight regularly after getting drunk. Their wives did not stay with them because of this. The incident came to light when the locals went to check after hearing noises. The man has been arrested.

203.title: Woman killed, hung from tree on suspicion of witchcraft in Assam
203.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was allegedly killed and then hung from a tree on suspicion of practising witchcraft in the Kokrajhar district of Assam, police said. Three people have been arrested in connection with the incident and a search is on to nab another accused. Stab wounds were found on the body of the woman.

204.title: Paytm grants 39.7 lakh ESOPs to employees as its share price falls
204.article_body: Paytm-parent One97 Communications has granted 39.7 lakh new employee stock ownership plans (ESOPs) to its employees as Paytm's share price fell to one of its lowest levels since November. The exercise price of the new ESOPs has been set at ₹9 each. As per Paytm's stock price on Monday, the value of the ESOPs is estimated to be ₹220.7 crore.

205.title: Rename BPSC to 'state leak commission': Tejashwi Yadav
205.article_body: RJD leader Tejashwi Yadav has criticised the Bihar government over the recent leak of the Bihar Public Service Commission's question papers for civil services (preliminary) examinations. "The BPSC has been in a mess is no great news. But after yesterday's incident, nothing more remains to be said. It (BPSC) should be renamed to 'state leak commission'," Yadav said.

206.title: Yesterday, I went to bed at 5:20 am: Zverev after Madrid Open defeat
206.article_body: World number three Alexander Zverev criticised the ATP Tour for its scheduling of late-night matches after he lost to 19-year-old Carlos Alcaraz in the Madrid Open final in straight sets. "Two days ago, I went to bed at 4:30 am. Yesterday, I went to bed at 5:20 am," revealed Zverev, who had his semi-final against Stefanos Tsitsipas late Saturday night.

207.title: Massive fire as 15 cylinders explode in Nagpur; 100 hutments damaged, girl missing
207.article_body: More than 15 LPG cylinders exploded in a residential area in Maharashtra's Nagpur on Monday, leading to a massive fire in which nearly 100 hutments were damaged. A fire department official said no casualty was reported in the incident, but a minor girl was missing. The incident took place in the Beltarodi area where several labourers live.

208.title: Malavika Mohanan to star opposite Prabhas in thriller 'Raja Deluxe': Report
208.article_body: Malavika Mohanan has reportedly been roped in to play the female lead in an upcoming supernatural action thriller titled 'Raja Deluxe', which will also feature Prabhas. It'll be directed by Maruthi and produced by 'RRR' producer DVV Danayya, according to the report. "The team has...decided to start work on film from the month of August," Pinkvilla said quoting a source.

209.title: Took me a while to break it: Isha Koppikar on being typecast post Ishq Samundar
209.article_body: Isha Koppikar, who has been a part of several movies, spoke about how she was typecast after her songs 'Ishq Samundar' and 'Khallas'. "If I had known this earlier, I wouldn't have probably done [these songs]," she said. "It was 'Khallas' and it was backed by 'Ishq Samundar'...It took me quite a while to break that typecast," she added.

210.title: 2 dead as train collides with car crossing railway track in Assam
210.article_body: Two persons were killed after a passenger train collided with a car in Assam's Dhemaji district on Monday. The accident took place when the train was on its way to Tinsukia in Assam from Naharlagun in Arunachal Pradesh. The accident was reported from the Bordoloni-Dhemaji section of the district.

211.title: Pune cloth trader pays ₹3 lakh for new clothing, gets bags full of rags
211.article_body: A cloth trader from Pune, who paid ₹3 lakh to a supplier for new clothing, reportedly got bags full of rags. The trader said that a transporter delivered five stacks of clothes and upon opening them, he found that they contained old clothes. Police said that they have launched a probe based on transactions made with the supplier.

212.title: 5 including 4 of family die as car suffers tyre burst, collides with mini-bus in Guj
212.article_body: Four members of a family were among five killed after their car suffered a tyre burst, jumped the road divider and collided with a luxury mini-bus on National Highway 27 on the outskirts of Gujarat's Morbi. The family was returning home after attending a wedding ceremony in Kutch. CM Bhupendra Patel has also expressed sorrow over the loss of lives.

213.title: Married under pressure, T'gana woman along with lover kills husband after 36 days
213.article_body: Telangana Police have arrested six people after a woman killed her husband along with her lover and four others after 36 days of her marriage. Police said Shyamala (19) was in love with Shiva Kumar (20) for the last three years, however, under pressure from the elders she married Chandrasekhar (24). Earlier, she tried to poison her husband to death.

214.title: West will do everything to make sure Putin loses: Canada PM
214.article_body: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau has said the West will do everything possible to make sure that Russian President Vladimir Putin loses the war against Ukraine. "What Putin needs to understand is that the West is absolutely determined and resolved to stand against what he is doing," said Trudeau during a surprise visit to Ukraine where he met President Volodymyr Zelenskyy.

215.title: 19-yr-old Alcaraz beats Zverev to win Madrid Open for 4th title of 2022
215.article_body: World number six Carlos Alcaraz won his second ATP Masters 1000 title of 2022 after beating second-seeded Alexander Zverev 6-3, 6-1 at Madrid Open on Sunday. Overall, it was the 19-year-old's fourth title this season. Notably, Alcaraz became the youngest winner in Madrid and the second youngest to win two Masters 1000 titles since Rafael Nadal in 2005.

216.title: Rupee is in ICU under PM Modi: Cong after rupee hits all-time low
216.article_body: Congress leader Randeep Surjewala on Monday said the Indian rupee "is in ICU (intensive care unit)" under PM Narendra Modi's government after the rupee fell to an all-time low of ₹77.41 against the US dollar. Surjewala said rising inflation and depleting foreign reserves are causing the rupee to fall. "BJP-sponsored" communal tension is also responsible for the fall, he added.

217.title: Nepal to close its borders 3 days before local polls on May 13
217.article_body: Nepal government has decided to close country's border entry points with India and China 72 hours before local level elections, which are slated to be held on May 13. All movement across districts that share its borders with neighbouring countries will be restricted, except for emergency services, an official said. Domestic flight operations will also be halted on election day.

218.title: MCD carrying out demolition drive to disturb atmosphere: AAP MLA
218.article_body: AAP MLA Amanatullah Khan joined the locals in their protest against the SDMC amid the ongoing anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Monday. "MCD is carrying out the drive to disturb the atmosphere," Khan added. "Why else have they come? If there is any encroachment in my constituency, tell me, and I will remove it," he stated.

219.title: Shooting, grenade attacks in Philippines amid elections; 3 dead
219.article_body: Incidents of shooting and grenade attacks have been reported in the Philippines' Maguindanao province amid the country's presidential election, which is being held on Monday. At least three people were killed after attackers in vans reportedly fired at a polling station in Buluan on election day. Furthermore, nine people were injured in grenade explosions in parts of Maguindanao on Sunday.

220.title: Rajkummar, Janhvi's 'Mr and Mrs Mahi' goes on floors in Mumbai
220.article_body: Rajkummar Rao and Janhvi Kapoor-starrer 'Mr & Mrs Mahi', backed by Karan Johar's Dharma Productions, went on floors in Mumbai on Monday. Karan took to Instagram Stories to share the news and wrote, "Best of luck to the entire team...for starting the first innings! Knock it out of the park." The cricket drama is being helmed by Sharan Sharma.

221.title: Noida Police arrests 3 for robbing people after meeting them on Tinder
221.article_body: Noida Police arrested two women and a man on Sunday for allegedly robbing and killing people after befriending them on dating apps, officers said. According to the police, the accused created fake profiles on Tinder and made friends with users. The accused would set up meetings, add sedatives in the victim's drinks and then escape with their belongings, police said.

222.title: 2 scrap dealers held for locking up policemen inside godown in Thane
222.article_body: Two scrap dealers were arrested for allegedly keeping two policemen captive inside their godown after the latter had come to inspect the premises of the dealers in Maharashtra's Thane district. The two policemen were looking for stolen rail tracks before allegedly being locked inside the godown by the two accused, identified as Shaukat Shaikh and Isaque Bhagwan, police said.

223.title: Man hurling Molotov cocktails near US police station shot dead
223.article_body: A man who was setting vehicles on fire by throwing Molotov cocktails outside a police station in the US was shot dead by officers. The police said they warned the man to stop but he refused, after which they opened fire. "The individual continued to throw multiple Molotov cocktails in the parking lot and eventually towards our officers," said police.

224.title: Won't let anyone annex Ukraine's victory over Nazism: Zelenskyy
224.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Monday marked Victory Day over Nazism in World War II and said, "We'll not allow anyone to annex this victory." He also named places in Ukraine which have been invaded by Russia, adding that Nazis were ousted from there. Furthermore, he said that these places "give us faith that we'll drive...occupiers from our land".

225.title: Sri Lanka PM Mahinda Rajapaksa resigns after state of emergency declared
225.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in the country, Sri Lankan Prime Minister Mahinda Rajapaksa on Monday resigned from the post. Earlier, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa declared a state of emergency as the country is struggling with acute food and electricity shortages. A spokesperson had said that Gotabaya declared the state of emergency to "ensure public order".

226.title: Alyssa Healy, Keshav Maharaj named ICC Players of the Month for April
226.article_body: Australia wicketkeeper-batter Alyssa Healy and South Africa spinner Keshav Maharaj have been voted as the ICC Women’s and Men’s Players of the Month, respectively for April 2022. Healy won the award for her match-winning innings of 170 in the 2022 Women's World Cup final against England. Meanwhile, Maharaj won the award for taking 16 wickets in two Tests against Bangladesh.

227.title: Don't file such pleas, this is too much: SC on Shaheen demolition drive petition
227.article_body: The Supreme Court while rejecting CPI(M)'s plea challenging Delhi's Shaheen Bagh anti-encroachment drive, said, "What are the High Courts for?" It added, "Don't file petitions like this. This is too much...We've never given any licence to everybody to come here and say my house is being demolished even if it's unauthorised." It asked CPI(M) to approach Delhi High Court.

228.title: Happy to build partnership with Gaikwad: Conway after 91-run win over DC
228.article_body: After posting 110 runs opening partnership and helping his side win by 91 runs against DC, CSK opener Devon Conway has said that he is happy to "build the partnership" with opening partner Ruturaj Gaikwad. "The way he is playing eases my job. Being an all-format player is my brand," Conway said after scoring 87 runs off 49 balls.

229.title: Better if wins had come earlier in the season: Dhoni after CSK's 4th win
229.article_body: After CSK won their fourth match of IPL 2022 by defeating Delhi Capitals by 91 runs, skipper MS Dhoni said that it would have been "better" if wins had "come earlier" in the season. "The big-margin win helps...But this was a perfect game," Dhoni said. After losing seven matches, CSK is currently at the eighth position in the points table.

230.title: Railways hikes platform ticket price to ₹50 in Mumbai to curb crowds
230.article_body: The Central Railway has announced a temporary hike in platform ticket rates from ₹10 to ₹50 from May 9 to 23 at some stations in Mumbai. The move is aimed at reducing the crowds at the stations and also preventing misuse of alarm chains. The tickets rates have also been hiked in neighbouring Thane, Kalyan and Panvel.

231.title: Akshay only praised Kashmir Files as his film didn't work: Vivek
231.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Agnihotri in an interview has stated that actor Akshay Kumar only praised his film 'The Kashmir Files' because his own film 'Bachchhan Paandey' didn't work at the box office. "What else can he say when 100 people stand and ask him about it? He was at a function in Bhopal so he had to praise it," Vivek added.

232.title: BJP to hold rally near Hyderabad on May 14, Amit Shah to attend
232.article_body: BJP's Telangana unit is planning to organise a rally at Tukkuguda, on the outskirts of Hyderabad, on May 14. "This public meeting will be attended by thousands of people and will show that...BJP is ready for the elections in the state," BJP leader Bandi Sanjay Kumar said. Senior party leaders, including Union Home Minister Amit Shah, will attend the rally.

233.title: I fully back every decision Pant takes on the field: Ponting
233.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting said he "fully backs every decision" that Rishabh Pant takes on the field during their matches. "It's easy to make judgments from outside but...when you're in the middle it's not an easy thing to do," he added. DC have lost six of their 11 games and are placed fifth on the IPL 2022 points table.

234.title: Will re-examine provisions of sedition law: Centre tells Supreme Court
234.article_body: The Centre on Monday told the Supreme Court that it "has decided to re-examine and reconsider" the provisions of the sedition law. Two days ago, the Centre had defended the sedition law saying that it is a valid law and that there are enough safeguards already in place to balance the constitutional rights of the citizens.

235.title: When I raised voice against forced conversion, I was threatened: Kaneria amid Afridi feud
235.article_body: Amid his feud with ex-Pakistan captain Shahid Afridi, Danish Kaneria said that when he raised his voice against forced conversion, he was threatened that his career would be destroyed. After Afridi criticised Kaneria for giving an interview against him to an Indian channel, Kaneria tweeted, "India isn't our enemy...Our enemies are those who instigate people in...name of religion."

236.title: Broke down when daughter wasn't leaving ventilator: Mahi Vij
236.article_body: Television actress Mahi Vij in an interview has revealed that her daughter Tara was born premature and was not leaving the ventilator. The actress added she tried IVF for the first time in 2014 aged 32. "Tara was our last try...After that even if I was being given 100 injections I wouldn't feel the pain," Mahi said.

237.title: Mahesh Babu recalls losing his 'dear ones', says 'A lot changed in these 2 yrs'
237.article_body: During a speech at an event, actor Mahesh Babu recalled the hard times and loss of his dear ones in last two years. He said, "In these two years...so much...changed. I've lost some of my dearest ones." "But your love and support didn't change...I'll move forward bravely. On 12th May...'Sarkaru Vaari Paata' will release...it's a festival for...us," he added.

238.title: Akshay remembers mom at trailer launch of Prithviraj, says 'Wish she was here'
238.article_body: Actor Akshay Kumar recently got teary-eyed at the trailer launch of his upcoming film, 'Prithviraj' as he remembered his late mother. He said, "I am very proud to be associated with the film and I wish my mother would've been around to see me playing this." He added that she would have been so proud of him.

239.title: It'll be huge dent in team's run-rate: Ponting on DC's 91-run loss vs CSK
239.article_body: DC head coach Ricky Ponting said despite his side's 91-run loss against CSK in IPL 2022 putting a "huge dent" in their net run-rate, DC can still make play-offs with wins in all the remaining three matches. "Eight wins might be enough to get in...one big win might help our net run-rate," he added. They've won five matches so far.

240.title: Worked with diction coach for over a month: Ranveer on 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'
240.article_body: Actor Ranveer Singh said that he worked with a diction coach for over a month while preparing for 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar'. "The way Jayeshbhai speaks is typical to those who hail from heartland Gujarat. I had to speak exactly how their Hindi would sound like...Divyang [director] ensured they [Gujarati artistes] were always around me on the sets," he added.

241.title: Man booked for circulating 19-yr-old girl's morphed pics in Ludhiana
241.article_body: A man was booked in Ludhiana for allegedly morphing a 19-year-old girl's pictures and circulating them on social media by creating her fake profile. "He had secretly captured a private moment between them and later uploaded the lewd pictures of the girl," a police official said. The accused purportedly circulated her printed photos in her locality to defame her.

242.title: Ready to make any sacrifice: Sri Lankan PM amid resignation reports
242.article_body: Sri Lankan PM Mahinda Rajapaksa has said that he's "ready to make any sacrifice for...people", local media reported. This comes as the country faces its worst economic crisis. Rajapaksa said this after workers from SLPP party, to which he belongs, gathered at his residence urging him to not step down from his post amid reports of his offer to resign.

243.title: Reliance's shares decline 3% after Q4 results, fall 9.8% in 6 days
243.article_body: Reliance Industries Limited's (RIL) shares declined 3% to ₹2,542.10 in the early hours of trading on Monday after the company's January-March quarter results were declared. RIL's shares have fallen 9.82% since April 29. RIL reported a 22.5% YoY rise in net profit to ₹16,203 crore and a 35% YoY rise in consolidated revenue to ₹2.32 lakh crore in Q4 FY22.

244.title: Bulldozers return from Delhi's Shaheen Bagh after protesters block roads
244.article_body: Bulldozers sent by Delhi civic body for a demolition drive in Shaheen Bagh returned without any action after protesters turned up in hundreds to block roads and stop the machines. The South Delhi Municipal Corporation had sent bulldozers to carry out an anti-encroachment drive in the area. The Supreme Court has refused to hear a plea challenging the drive.

245.title: EU law regulating Apple, Google to come into effect in spring 2023
245.article_body: The European Union will begin enforcing the Digital Markets Act (DMA) in spring 2023, European Commission Executive Vice President Margrethe Vestager has stated. The antitrust law aims to curb the power of 'gatekeeper companies', including Meta, Google, Microsoft, Apple and Amazon. If found violating rules repeatedly, these entities could be fined up to 20% of their total global turnover.

246.title: SC rejects plea against Shaheen Bagh demolition drive, asks petitioner to move HC
246.article_body: The Supreme Court (SC) on Monday refused to entertain the plea filed by the Communist Party of India (Marxist) against the anti-encroachment drive in Delhi's Shaheen Bagh area. The SC further asked the petitioner to approach the Delhi High Court on the matter. The JCB bulldozer, brought in for the anti-encroachment drive in Shaheen Bagh, has now left the area.

247.title: Made best possible decision: IndiGo on barring differently-abled child from flight
247.article_body: IndiGo's CEO Ronojoy Dutta said the airline made "the best possible decision" by barring a differently-abled teenager and his family from boarding a Ranchi-Hyderabad flight. "At boarding area, the teenager was visibly in panic...the airport staff, in line with safety guidelines, were forced to make a difficult decision," Dutta said. IndiGo offered to purchase an electric wheelchair for the child.

248.title: New version of 'best pic' of a UFO ever taken released
248.article_body: A newer high-resolution version of a picture widely regarded as the 'best photograph' of a UFO ever taken has been released. The picture was originally taken by an automated camera used by the National Geographic Institute of Costa Rica over 50 years ago in 1971. A camera attached to a government mapping plane had captured the shiny round floating object.

249.title: 3 killed as speeding gas tanker hits 3 cars on Pune-Mumbai Expressway
249.article_body: Three people were killed and at least two others injured after a speeding gas tanker hit three cars as it turned on its side on Pune-Mumbai Expressway in Maharashtra's Raigad district on Monday. The tanker was going from Pune to Mumbai. Due to high speed, it crossed over to the opposite lane as the driver lost control of the vehicle.

250.title: Hyderabad Police nab man for IPL betting racket, seize ₹44,600
250.article_body: Police on Saturday apprehended a man at a bar in Hyderabad for allegedly participating in an IPL betting racket and seized ₹44,600 from his possession. The 36-year-old accused, identified as Gandam Srinivas, was nabbed while placing a bet on an ongoing match, police said. The accused would place his bets through an online application, police added.

251.title: Wicket had no bounce, so our batters looked to hit Umran: Hasaranga
251.article_body: RCB spinner Wanindu Hasaranga has revealed that their batters had planned to hit SRH pacer Umran Malik in their match on Sunday. "Umran...bowls back of the length balls, so...[on] this wicket where there was no bounce, [batters] were looking for him," said Hasaranga. Umran bowled two overs, conceding 20 runs in the first over and five in the second.

252.title: Was worried about being written off due to my South Indian accent: Deepika
252.article_body: Actress Deepika Padukone said that her South Indian accent was frowned upon and  that she was initially worried about being written off. "As an outsider to the industry, I inadvertently ended up becoming an observer...Earlier, I probably didn't have the confidence or the clout to be able to effect change, but the desire for it was always there," she added.

253.title: Pak's Sindh CM asks farmers to not grow rice due to water scarcity
253.article_body: Pakistan's Sindh Chief Minister Syed Murad Ali Shah has asked the farmers to not cultivate rice owing to the scarcity of water in the country. His comment came while talking to the media in Sehwan Sharif on Saturday. Expressing concern over unequal distribution of water, Shah said that it should be equally distributed throughout the country.

254.title: Mysterious metal object crashes through roof of house in Australia, pics surface
254.article_body: A mysterious metal object crashed through the roof of a house in the Australian city of Gympie. The family living in the house said that they heard a loud bang and saw smoke and debris everywhere. "We're not sure if it was space junk, because it's sharp, and it looks like it's come off something," the family said.

255.title: Zelenskyy awards medal to mine-sniffing dog who has found over 200 explosives
255.article_body: Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy has presented the mine sniffing dog, Patron, and his owner with a medal to recognise their service. The pint-size Jack Russell terrier has been credited with detecting over 200 explosives and preventing their detonation since the start of the war. Zelenskyy presented the award at a news conference in Kyiv with Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.

256.title: Delhi man shot dead outside party after fight with drunk man brandishing pistol
256.article_body: A 38-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly shooting dead a 23-year-old man in Delhi. The victim was trying to leave a party when the accused allegedly followed him and shot him dead, police said. Police claimed the accused was drunk when he allegedly brandished his pistol and hurled slurs at the victim, when the men got into an altercation.

257.title: Residents protest against garbage depot on banks of Ramnadi in Pune
257.article_body: Residents of Bhugaon, Bavdhan and Bhukum areas in Pune district staged a human chain protest over an illegal waste management project along the flood lines of Ramnadi. Maharashtra BJP chief Chandrakant Patil on behalf of the residents has requested Pune Municipal Corporation commissioner to conduct a meeting on May 9. The project was earlier rejected by standing committee, Patil said.

258.title: Bitcoin falls to the lowest level since January, trades below $34,000
258.article_body: Bitcoin fell on Monday to as low as $33,266 in morning trade, nearing January's low of $32,951 as slumping equity markets continued to hurt cryptocurrencies. It then steadied to trade above $33,600. According to BBC, the world's largest cryptocurrency has fallen by 50% since its peak in November 2021.

259.title: Job interest in Twitter rises over 250% after it accepts Musk's buyout deal
259.article_body: The interest in Twitter jobs on Glassdoor rose 263% in a week after Twitter accepted Elon Musk's $44 billion takeover bid. The data was shared on Twitter by Daniel Zhao, Glassdoor's lead data scientist. "Say what you will about Elon, he does have a large fanbase of people excited to work for him," Zhao tweeted.

260.title: NIA raids premises of Dawood Ibrahim's aides in Mumbai, 1 detained
260.article_body: The National Investigation Agency (NIA) conducted raids against associates of gangster Dawood Ibrahim at several locations in Mumbai on Monday. Reports said that the officers of the agency detained Salim Qureshi, an associate of gangster Chhota Shakeel. Some important documents were also seized. ANI reported NIA had earlier registered a case over drug peddlers being associated with Dawood.

261.title: Actor Faisal Shaikh to participate in 'Khatron...', says 'I'm ready for thrill'
261.article_body: Actor Faisal Shaikh aka Mr Faisu is all set to enter the stunt-based reality show 'Khatron Ke Khiladi 12', hosted by Rohit Shetty. Speaking about the show, Faisal said, "From being social media super-star to now participating in Khatron Ke Khiladi, the feeling itself is unfathomable." "I'm ready for the thrill, action and adventure that awaits this season," he added.

262.title: Mumbai doctor suffers cardiac arrest while trekking to Everest base camp in Nepal, dies
262.article_body: A 52-year-old woman doctor from Mumbai died while trekking to the base camp of Mount Everest in Nepal, her family member said. "Dr Pradnya Samant, a resident of Goregaon, died of cardiac arrest at the Everest base camp...There was no accident," he added. The family member had claimed that the deceased's last rites will be performed at Goregaon's Shivdham crematorium.

263.title: Fred Savage fired from Wonder Years after allegations of inappropriate conduct
263.article_body: Fred Savage has been dropped from the comedy series 'The Wonder Years' following multiple complaints of misconduct in his role as executive producer and director. "We were made aware of allegations of inappropriate conduct by Fred, and as is policy, an investigation was launched. Upon its completion, decision was made to terminate his employment," Wonder Years producer 20th Television said.

264.title: Putin likens action in Ukraine to fight against Nazis in WWII
264.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin on Monday equated its current action against Ukraine to Soviet forces' fight against the Nazi soldiers in World War II. He was addressing an event at Moscow's Red Square on the 77th anniversary of Victory Day, which marks Soviet's win over the Nazis. A minute of silence was observed to honour the fallen soldiers.

265.title: Need to get creative, come up with ways to change the momentum: Williamson
265.article_body: SRH captain Kane Williamson said they need to come up with ways to change the momentum after they suffered their fourth straight defeat in the ongoing IPL season. "I think earlier in the competition when there was assistance with the new ball, we were certainly very threatening, so [now] we need to go back to the drawing board," he added.

266.title: Military action in Ukraine necessary, Russia fighting for motherland: Putin on Victory Day
266.article_body: Addressing a parade in Moscow's Red Square, Russian President Vladimir Putin said intervention in Ukraine was necessary because the West was "preparing for the invasion of our land, including Crimea". Putin said, "You're fighting for your Motherland, its future." Russia marks May 9 as Victory Day to commemorate the Soviet Union's victory over Germany's Nazi forces in World War II.

267.title: YouTuber Emma Chamberlain wore Maharaja of Patiala's choker to Met Gala
267.article_body: YouTuber Emma Chamberlain wore a choker that belonged to Maharaja of Patiala Bhupinder Singh during her appearance at the Met Gala. Emma, who is the ambassador of Cartier, wore the choker that was made in 1928 after the Maharaja decided to turn his De Beers diamond into a choker. Called the Patiala Necklace, it has 2930 diamonds and Burmese rubies.

268.title: I couldn't be happier: Ayushmann Khurrana on Anek's trailer response
268.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana said he's happy about the way audiences have reacted to the trailer of his upcoming film 'Anek'. He said, "I've always hunted for clutter-breaking content and 'Anek' rests at the top of the pile for me." "I'm delighted with the response...It has struck a chord in the hearts of Indians and I couldn't be happier," he added.

269.title: Krushna breaks down over tiff with uncle Govinda during podcast, says 'I miss you a lot'
269.article_body: On being asked about the tiff between him and his uncle Govinda on the 'The Maniesh Paul Podcast', comedian Krushna Abhishek said, "Whenever I speak to...media...things are put together out of context." He broke down and said he misses his uncle "a lot". "I want my babies to play with him...I know he misses me a lot too," he added.

270.title: Man, aides booked for killing 25-yr-old man in Ambala over old enmity
270.article_body: Police booked a man and his associates for allegedly murdering a 25-year-old man in Ambala's Ahema village on Saturday night. The deceased's father, the complainant, stated that the accused forced the victim to consume alcohol before pushing him into the river. There has been an old enmity between the main accused and the complainant's family.

271.title: A simple 'forget me not' message: Kaif as Pujara hits 4 tons in 4 straight county matches
271.article_body: After Cheteshwar Pujara smashed four hundreds in four straight county matches, former India batter Mohammad Kaif tweeted, "What do great players do when out of India team? Knock the selectors' doors with 100s and 200s like Pujara." He added, "Away from IPL glamour, a simple 'forget me not' message." Pujara has scored 717 runs in the ongoing county season.

272.title: SC to hear petition against Shaheen Bagh demolition at 2 pm today
272.article_body: The Supreme Court has agreed to hear Communist Party of India (Marxist's) plea against Shaheen Bagh demolition at 2 pm on Monday. Court asked petitioner to provide copy of petition to Solicitor General. The apex court also asked the South Delhi administration why it began demolishing alleged encroachments at Shaheen Bagh when hearing was scheduled in the court on Monday.

273.title: MS Dhoni heard saying 'Well done, old man' to Dwayne Bravo on stump mic
273.article_body: CSK's 40-year-old captain MS Dhoni was heard saying 'Well done, old man' to 38-year-old all-rounder Dwayne Bravo after his fielding effort in DC's 17th over on Sunday. Bravo had made a diving effort to stop a single at the cover area. CSK went on to defeat DC by 91 runs, registering the biggest win of IPL 2022.

274.title: Defence services aspirants protest in Haryana over pending recruitment tests
274.article_body: Several youths staged protests in various parts of Haryana, asking government to conduct pending written tests for recruitment in wings of the armed forces. Aspirants alleged screening and physical tests were conducted about two years ago but written tests were deferred due to COVID-19 pandemic. A protestor said that due to delay, some aspirants have crossed their maximum age limit.

275.title: Jasprit Bumrah's form in IPL 2022 is not a concern at all: Ravi Shastri
275.article_body: Ex-India coach Ravi Shastri has said MI pacer Jasprit Bumrah's form in the ongoing IPL season is "not a concern at all". "It's just that oppositions have played him differently. They don't want to give him wickets...there's no issue of ability whatsoever," added Shastri. Bumrah has picked five wickets in their 10 games so far in the ongoing IPL season.

276.title: Conducted drills near Taiwan between May 6 and May 8: Chinese army
276.article_body: Eastern Theatre Command of China's People's Liberation Army has said in a statement that it conducted naval and air force drills near Taiwan between May 6 and May 8. Last week, Taiwan said that 18 Chinese military aircraft entered its air defence zone. The Chinese army added that the drills were to "further test and improve the joint combat capability".

277.title: Marriage is working for him: CSK's Moeen Ali on Conway smashing 3 fifties in a row
277.article_body: Referring to his teammate Devon Conway smashing three straight fifties in IPL 2022, CSK all-rounder Moeen Ali said, "Obviously marriage is working for him. He is doing well ever since." Calling Devon a "brilliant player", Moeen added, "He is somebody who gets a lot of runs...he's got great shots." Conway had briefly left the bio-bubble for his marriage last month.

278.title: It's demand of time to make health accessible, affordable: Mandaviya
278.article_body: It is the demand of time to make health accessible and affordable, Union Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya said on Monday in Delhi. "Whose responsibility it is to ensure health facilities for the people? State governments, central government and health workers force," Mandaviya added. "We are all stakeholders," he further stated.

279.title: Sahitya Akademi award-winning writer Nilotpal Mrinal booked for raping woman for 10 years
279.article_body: Delhi Police have booked Sahitya Akademi award-winning writer Nilotpal Mrinal for allegedly raping a 32-year-old woman for 10 years under the pretext of marriage. The woman is a UPSC aspirant who has been living in Delhi. The FIR stated that a police officer called up the woman's father and told him she is blackmailing Mrinal to extort money from him.

280.title: Technical glitch briefly disrupts Mumbai's local train service
280.article_body: Mumbai local trains were briefly disrupted in the early hours of Monday due to the breakdown of an overhead electrical wire. "Due to...breakdown between Dahisar-Borivali at 5:50 am all UP through trains are being diverted...UP fast locals delayed by 15 min," the Western Railway tweeted. Notably, the problem was rectified by 7:23 am, the Western Railway said.

281.title: CWC to meet today, days ahead of Udaipur 'chintan shivir'
281.article_body: The Congress Working Committee (CWC) is set to hold a meeting on Monday evening in Delhi days ahead of the 'chintan shivir' (brainstorming session) to be held in Rajasthan's Udaipur. Proposals from six panels formed on various issues will be discussed and finalised in the meeting, a party leader said. The three-day 'chintan shivir' will begin from May 13.

282.title: Cong workers sit in protest against demolition drive in Shaheen Bagh
282.article_body: Congress workers reportedly sat on roads protesting against the BJP-led MCD's anti-encroachment drive in Shaheen Bagh, Delhi. Several members even climbed atop a bulldozer before being detained by the police. The MCD is scheduled to run the drive with the assistance of the police force on Monday. Notably, the drive will cover Jasola Canal and Kalindi Kunj park as well.

283.title: Haryana IPS officer Hemant Kalson booked for abusing, misbehaving with nurse
283.article_body: Haryana-cadre IPS officer Hemant Kalson has been booked for allegedly abusing and misbehaving with a staff nurse at Panchkula's Civil Hospital. The nurse said that the officer, who held liquor bottle and gutka packet, had come to visit a female patient. She added that the officer shouted at the security guard and wanted to take the woman away.

284.title: Injected Rizwan with prohibited substance for recovery after asking ICC: Doctor on T20 WC
284.article_body: Pakistan cricket team doctor Najeebullah Soomro has revealed that Pakistan wicketkeeper-batter Muhammad Rizwan was injected with a prohibited substance for recovery after he developed a severe chest infection ahead of the T20 World Cup 2021 semi-final. Soomro said that doctors took prior permission from ICC. Rizwan spent two nights in ICU and went on to play the semi-final against Australia.

285.title: One day you'll become country's pride: 'Liger' maker on Deverakonda's b'day
285.article_body: 'Liger' director Puri Jagannadh has penned a note to wish actor Vijay Deverakonda on his birthday. "I saw the fire in your heart. I saw the fine actor inside you. I know what's running in your mind. Your hunger, your madness...your humbleness all these will take you to...places," he wrote, adding, "One day you'll become the country's pride. Happy Birthday."

286.title: 'Gau rakshaks' demand arms licences at Haryana mahapanchayat
286.article_body: Hindu groups such as VHP, Bajrang Dal and Gau Raksha Dal held a mahapanchayat in Haryana's Nuh district on Sunday, in which 'gau rakshaks' voiced several demands including arms licences. "Arms licences for 'gau rakshaks' should be given and FIRs against [them] should be withdrawn," demanded one of the organisers. Properties of cow smuggling-accused should be confiscated, he added.

287.title: Atal Bihari Vajpayee Stadium wall collapses month after inauguration in B'luru
287.article_body: As rains lashed several parts of Bengaluru, wall of newly constructed Atal Bihari Vajpayee stadium collapsed on Sunday. Reports said iron bars were seen scattered and the slabs were torn by heavy rain. The stadium that was built at a cost of ₹50 crore in HSR layout was inaugurated on March 1. Power supply was also interrupted in several places.

288.title: Salman Khan's lookalike shoots reel on UP road leading to a traffic jam; arrested
288.article_body: Azam Ansari, a lookalike of actor Salman Khan, was arrested by Lucknow police on allegations of disturbing the peace in public areas. He was taken into custody while he was recording a reel in the Thakurganj area. While a huge crowd gathered on the road to see his performance, it resulted in a traffic jam.

289.title: Saw a soldier in you: Parineeti to Priyanka over daughter's hospitalisation
289.article_body: As actress Priyanka Chopra shared an update about her daughter returning from the hospital after over 100 days, actress Parineeti Chopra said, "Mimi didi - I saw a soldier in the hospital - You. And little BD has taught us so much already and she doesn't even know it! Chalo now time to start spoiling her."

290.title: James Gunn wraps up 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3', shares pic with cast
290.article_body: Filmmaker James Gunn, in an Instagram post, announced the wrap of 'Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 3'. He shared a picture in which he could be seen sitting next to the cast members of the Marvel movie, including Chris Pratt, Karen Gillan and Dave Bautista. "I love this...cast...I'm lucky...to have them on...journey with me for nearly a decade," James wrote.

291.title: 9% women, 38% men above 15 yrs use tobacco products: NFHS
291.article_body: Overall, 9% of women and 38% of men above 15 years of age use tobacco products, as per the National Family Health Survey 5 (2019-21). The NFHS-5 survey was conducted in an approximate 6.37 lakh sample households across 707 districts in 28 states and eight UTs. Tobacco use among men aged 15 and over is highest in Mizoram at 73%.

292.title: What did you get out of this?: Woman slaps accused who caused Indore building fire
292.article_body: The elder sister of the woman whose scooter was torched by the accused in Madhya Pradesh's Indore, slapped the latter in front of the police while asking him, "What did you get out of this?" He torched her sister's scooter after she rejected his marriage offer, causing a fire at a three-storey building in which seven people died.

293.title: Madhuri shares new pic with sisters, fan says 'Never seen them before'
293.article_body: Madhuri Dixit shared a new picture with her two sisters and their mother on the occasion of Mother's Day. Sharing the photo, Madhuri wrote, "All that I'm, all that I'll ever be, it'll be...your reflection Aai." The photo showed Madhuri and her sisters Roopa and Bharti in black outfits. Reacting to it, a user commented, "Never seen your sisters before."

294.title: Bodies of 3 men recovered from 2 areas in canal in Pune's Hadapsar
294.article_body: The bodies of three men were recovered from two different locations in a canal in Pune's Hadapsar on Sunday, the district's fire brigade said. Two of the bodies, recovered from near Shinde Vasti, were decomposed and might've died several days ago, an official said. The official added that prima facie, the third body, recovered from near Vaiduwadi, might've died recently.

295.title: A grand alliance to be formed against BJP in 2024: OP Rajbhar
295.article_body: SBSP National President Om Prakash Rajbhar has claimed that the opposition will form a grand alliance against the BJP in the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. "I met Mamata ji, Sharad Pawar, Uddhav Thackeray, and Lalu ji. Our duty is to make efforts and bring everyone on one platform. Let's see if it (Opposition alliance for 2024 polls) happens," Rajbhar said.

296.title: Bulldozers arrive for demolition drive at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh, locals sit on roads
296.article_body: Bulldozers were brought in for South Delhi Municipal Corporation's anti-encroachment drive at Delhi's Shaheen Bagh on Monday. Deputy Commissioner of Police (South-East) Esha Pandey said, "We are providing security to the civic body for the demolition drive in Shaheen Bagh." Locals sat on roads and stopped bulldozers. Notably, Shaheen Bagh was the centre of the protest against the citizenship law.

297.title: It's time to convert the starts: Ravi Shastri on Rohit ahead of KKR match
297.article_body: Ahead of MI's game against KKR on Monday, ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri said it's time for MI captain Rohit Sharma to convert his starts in the tournament. "MI don't have anything to play for in this tournament except pride...They'll want to finish with a bang," he added. Rohit has scored 39, 2 and 43 in their last three games.

298.title: Narcotic, love jihad to be key issues in Kerala bypoll: BJP leader
298.article_body: BJP's Kerala Vice-President AN Radhakrishnan has claimed that "love jihad" and "narcotic jihad" will be the "major issues" in the upcoming Thrikkakara Assembly bypoll in Kerala. "It upsets the social balance. All sections of the people are against it. Murders, rapes and suicides...recently are a matter of major concern," said Radhakrishnan who is also the BJP candidate for the bypoll.

299.title: Alia Bhatt trolled for endorsing products having sugar despite terming sugar unhealthy
299.article_body: Actress Alia Bhatt has been trolled for endorsing products having sugar despite herself claiming to not consume sugar due to it being "unhealthy". "Hypocrisy at its best," a user tweeted. Another user wrote, "Money speaks". "Why does Alia promote sugary products if sugar is unhealthy and she won't have it herself?" wrote another.

300.title: Had goosebumps during narration, immediately said yes: Akshay on Prithviraj
300.article_body: Akshay Kumar, speaking about his upcoming film 'Prithviraj', said, "When I was narrated the film, I'd goosebumps through...narration and immediately said yes to the project because the script blew me away." He added that the film brings together history and patriotism, and also tells a story of love that is extremely rare to find. 'Prithviraj' will release on June 3.

301.title: Groom wearing 'sherwani' at wedding leads to violent clash & stone-pelting in MP
301.article_body: A tribal groom wearing 'sherwani' at his wedding led to a dispute between his and the bride's family in Madhya Pradesh's Dhar district, following which people from the two sides allegedly hurled stones at each other and indulged in a violent clash, police said. The bride's relatives insisted the groom wear 'dhoti-kurta' during the rituals, as per their tribal tradition.

302.title: 23-yr-old MBBS student kills self with father's pistol in Karnal
302.article_body: A 23-year-old MBBS student allegedly killed himself with his father's licensed pistol in Karnal's Nissing, police said on Sunday. "The reason behind incident has not been ascertained yet," Investigation Officer, Ajaib Singh, said. The deceased was a Karnal-based doctor's son and a final year student at a college in Bengaluru. His family members said he had come home last month.

303.title: SRH won 5 games in a row, I don't know why they made changes: Kaif
303.article_body: After SRH suffered their fourth straight defeat in the ongoing IPL season, former India batter Mohammad Kaif said, "The overall team combination of SRH has gone awry." He added, "I don't know why they made so many drastic changes to their team after five consecutive wins. It's a surprise they haven't managed to fit Jansen into the playing XI."

304.title: Anti-abortion centre in US set on fire, Molotov cocktail found
304.article_body: "If abortions aren't safe then you aren't either," read a message spray-painted outside the building of an anti-abortion centre that was attacked and set on fire in the Madison city of US' Wisconsin. The police said a Molotov cocktail was found at the site. No casualties were reported in the incident. This comes amid protests in support of abortion rights.

305.title: Kangana, Ekta Kapoor, Munawar Faruqui attend Lock Upp's success party
305.article_body: A success party was held for 'Lock Upp' after Munawar Faruqui was announced as the winner. Actors Kangana Ranaut, Tusshar Kapoor, producer Ekta Kapoor, Munawar and the contestants of the show attended the party. Kangana later took to Instagram to share a picture of her "badass" crew, which included Karan Kundrra, Sara Khan, Mandana Karimi, Tejasswi Prakash and Poonam Pandey.

306.title: 16-yr-old girl gang raped in UP, consumes poison along with male friend
306.article_body: A 16-year-old girl consumed poison along with her male friend after she was allegedly gang-raped by two boys in Uttar Pradesh's Bijnor. The girl and her male friend were rushed to district hospital. The boy died on Sunday while the girl is still critical. Police said that the two boys have been arrested after the girl's father lodged a complaint.

307.title: 2 tourists stray beyond sea beach, drown in water in West Bengal
307.article_body: Two tourists, including a woman, died after drowning in sea in West Bengal's Purba Medinipur district on Sunday. An officer said the tourists had strayed beyond the sea beach and waded into the water. The officer added that they were swept into the sea in choppy waters. "Hearing their screams...disaster management personnel...jumped into waters to rescue them," the officer said.

308.title: 29 people injured as KSRTC bus meets with an accident in Bengaluru
308.article_body: As many as 25 people were injured and four others seriously injured after a Karnataka State Road Transport Corporation (KSRTC) bus met with an accident in Bengaluru on Monday. The bus had about 45 passengers on board, DCP (West Division) Sanjeev Patil said. According to reports, bus collided with a metro pillar after the driver, who was speeding, lost control.

309.title: Shoojit told Deepika 'Don't have to please anyone as Piku': Piku screenwriter
309.article_body: 'Piku' screenwriter Juhi Chaturvedi said film's director Shoojit Sircar told actress Deepika Padukone that she did not have to please anyone as 'Piku'. "[Sircar said] It doesn't matter whether Rana likes you or not...whether Bashkor likes you or not," Juhi said, adding, "Deepika said 'I don't know what this film is about, but I can sense that this is me'."

310.title: Ukraine won't accept Russian dictatorship: Germany
310.article_body: German Chancellor Olaf Scholz on Sunday said that there can be no peace in Ukraine under Russian dictatorship. "Ukraine will not accept that, and neither will we," he said in a speech to mark the 77th anniversary of the end of World War II in Europe. Scholz further said that Ukraine will prevail in the ongoing conflict.

311.title: How can KKR still qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs?
311.article_body: KKR are ninth on IPL 2022 points table with eight points. They'd require to win each of their remaining three matches with big margins to advance with 14 points and a superior net run-rate. Their fate will also depend on other teams. They'd need MI to win their last three matches and RCB to lose their remaining two matches.

312.title: Verstappen wins Miami GP to cut Leclerc's championship lead to 19 points
312.article_body: Red Bull's Max Verstappen won the inaugural Miami Grand Prix to secure his third race this season and 23rd of his career. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc finished second while his fellow Ferrari driver Carlos Sainz finished third. Verstappen, who's second on the season's driver standings, has 85 points with Leclerc at the top having 104 points.

313.title: Sean Bean wins Leading Actor, Jodie Comer bags Leading Actress at BAFTA TV Awards
313.article_body: Sean Bean won the award in the Leading Actor category, while Jodie Comer bagged the Leading Actress award at the BAFTA TV Awards 2022 on Sunday. Sean won the award for his performance in 'Time' and Jodie was awarded for her role in 'Help'. Gabrielle Creevy and Jo Hartley's comedy-drama 'In My Skin' won the Best Drama Series award.

314.title: 'Sex Education' actor Ncuti Gatwa to play lead in 'Doctor Who'
314.article_body: Ncuti Gatwa, known for portraying Eric Effiong in 'Sex Education', will replace Jodie Whittaker as the lead in British science-fiction television programme 'Doctor Who'. Speaking at the BAFTA TV Awards 2022, Ncuti said, "It's been emotional...I woke up crying then I started dancing. I'm glad it's finally out." Jodie became the first woman to play the Time Lord in 2017.

315.title: Rupee hits all-time low of 77.42 against US dollar
315.article_body: The Indian rupee fell to an all-time low of 77.42 against the US dollar on Monday, Reuters reported. Asian markets were lower on Monday as US stock futures fell on fears of more policy tightening from the Federal Reserve and strict lockdown in Shanghai impacting global growth, according to Reuters.

316.title: BSF shoots down Pak drone carrying 10.67 kg of heroin in Punjab
316.article_body: The BSF Punjab Frontier tweeted on Monday that its troops had foiled a smuggling attempt in Amritsar through a drone which had come from Pakistan. It said that the troops had shot down the drone that was carrying nine packets of suspected heroin weighing 10.67 kg in a bag. In April, BSF had shot down another Pakistani drone in Amritsar.

317.title: Earlier I wasn't comfortable wearing jeans because of my weight: Shehnaaz
317.article_body: Speaking about her fashion choices that have evolved lately, actor-singer Shehnaaz Gill said, "Earlier, I had limited earnings, so I did styling according to that. Also, I wasn't comfortable in jeans back then because everyone can't carry them with that weight." "I was...comfortable mostly in suits. But now...I'm making more money, I can style myself better," she added.

318.title: Blast in firecracker factory in UP's Saharanpur, 5 dead
318.article_body: A blast took place in a firecracker factory located in the Govindpur village of Uttar Pradesh's Saharanpur district. During the time of the incident, six people were inside the factory out of which five got killed while the remaining one has sustained serious injuries, police said. The deceased are identified as Rahul, Sumit, Karthik, Sagar and Vardhan Pal.

319.title: 5 dairy owners booked for using banned oxytocin on buffaloes in Guj
319.article_body: Five dairy owners in Gujarat's Palanpur were booked following a raid by authorities for allegedly using oxytocin injection, which is banned for retail sale, on buffaloes to increase their milk production. The matter came to light after two tourists, who're part of an animal welfare organisation, visited some dairy farms. Over 12 oxytocin bottles were confiscated, a police official said.

320.title: GST Council may consider highest 28% tax on cryptocurrencies: Report
320.article_body: The GST Council is considering levying a 28% tax on cryptocurrencies and their related services, as per a report. While the proposal is likely to be discussed in the next GST Council meeting, its date is yet to be decided. Notably, the Finance Ministry has already imposed a 30% income tax on earnings from virtual digital asset transactions.

321.title: Kohli can find form only by playing, not by resting: Dilip Vengsarkar
321.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Dilip Vengsarkar has suggested Virat Kohli to keep playing to find his form. "If he is failing and he takes off, doubts will start creeping into his mind. That is not the way to go about it," explained Vengsarkar. Kohli has registered three golden ducks and has scored 216 runs in 12 games so far in IPL 2022.

322.title: Hyd murder against Islam, woman's brother had no right to kill: Owaisi
322.article_body: AIMIM chief Asaduddin Owaisi took to Twitter to talk about the man who was murdered by his wife's family in Hyderabad. "The murder of Nagaraju in Hyderabad is against Islam. The girl married him out of her own will...Her brother had no right to kill her husband. It is a criminal act and worst crime as per Islam," Owaisi said.

323.title: Don't allow bars to open till 3 am in Delhi: BJP writes to police
323.article_body: Delhi BJP has written a letter to Police Commissioner Rakesh Asthana asking him not to allow bars to stay open till 3 am in the national capital. This comes after CM Arvind Kejriwal-led government decided to relax the timings to further improve the city's nightlife. Delhi BJP Spokesperson Praveen Shankar Kapoor said the move will create law and order problems.

324.title: Giving batting advice to Virat Kohli is like showing torch to sun: Amit Mishra
324.article_body: Reacting to Sportskeeda asking its followers what advice they'd give to Virat Kohli amid his poor form, veteran leg-spinner Amit Mishra tweeted, "Giving batting advice to Kohli is like showing torch to sun." He added, "Just a matter of few games before he comes back strong as ever. He did it after 2014 England tour and he'll do it again."

325.title: Anarchist Kejriwal, separatist forces trying to enter HP together: Tejasvi
325.article_body: BJP leader Tejasvi Surya on Sunday reacted to the Khalistan flags incident in Himachal Pradesh and called AAP national convenor Arvind Kejriwal an "anarchist". "Not a coincidence that anarchist Kejriwal and separatist forces are trying to enter Himachal Pradesh together. Himachal must identify and isolate such forces of destruction," Surya tweeted.

326.title: BJP looking for another Ayodhya issue: Cong leader on Gyanvapi mosque case
326.article_body: Congress leader Pramod Tiwari said BJP is trying to turn the Gyanvapi mosque case into an Ayodhya-like issue so that they can politicise. "BJP's condition is like a wingless bird after Ayodhya's verdict as they can't fight politics on jobs, inflation and 'achhe din'", Tiwari added. "They are looking for another Ayodhya issue so that they can politicise," he stated.

327.title: Police seizes 800 kg of marijuana consignment in Hyderabad
327.article_body: The Cyberabad Metropolitan Police seized a UP-bound marijuana consignment worth ₹2 crore in Hyderabad. A total of 800 kilograms of marijuana was kept inside 64 different packets, police said. Notably, the consignment was being taken to UP's Bulandshahr from Rajahmundry in Andhra Pradesh. Two people have been arrested while the search is on to catch the supplier and other suspects.

328.title: Ozone levels cross safe limit in Delhi; JLN Stadium worst-affected
328.article_body: The level of ground-level ozone crossed the safe limit in many parts of Delhi as heatwave conditions pushed temperature to unusually high levels, data from Delhi Pollution Control Committee (DPCC) showed. The highest values were recorded at JLN stadium. Dr Karni Singh Shooting Range, Nehru Nagar, Mandir Marg, RK Puram and Narela also breached the safe limit.

329.title: Not a big fan of Maths, wasn't good at it in school too: Dhoni on CSK's playoffs chances
329.article_body: On being told by commentator Murali Kartik that CSK mathematically still have the chance to qualify for IPL 2022 playoffs, MS Dhoni said, "I'm not a big fan of Maths...even in school I wasn't good at it." He added, "You write your own fortune...If we [advance], it's very good, but if we don't, it's not the end of the world."

330.title: I will do my best to stay alive: Musk to his mother after 'mysterious dying' tweet
330.article_body: Soon after Tesla CEO Elon Musk shared a tweet about his "mysterious death", his mother Maye Musk commented that it wasn't funny. Responding to her, Musk wrote, "Sorry! I will do my best to stay alive." Musk's 'dying' tweet came after he shared a statement by the Roscosmos director that threatened him for supplying "fascist forces" to Ukraine.

331.title: BJP, RSS turning Lord Ram who's symbol of love into Rambo: Baghel
331.article_body: Chhattisgarh CM Bhupesh Baghel during an interview accused the BJP and RSS of turning Lord Ram who is a "symbol of love" into "Rambo". He also claimed that Lord Hanuman's old pictures show him as being "meditative and devotional" but the BJP and RSS are making him "angry and aggressive". Furthermore, he said that BJP's "idea of nationalism is imported".

332.title: India reports 3,207 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 20,403
332.article_body: India has reported 3,207 COVID-19 cases, 3,410 recoveries and 29 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country saw 3,451 COVID-19 cases and 40 deaths. Active cases in India stand at 20,403, while the death toll has risen to 5,24,093.

333.title: Pic of MS Dhoni 'eating' his bat goes viral, Amit Mishra says 'He does it to keep it clean'
333.article_body: A picture of MS Dhoni using his teeth on his bat during CSK's match against DC went viral. A Twitter user commented, "Reminds me of childhood...Dhoni eating bat." "He does that to remove tape of...bat as he likes [it] to be clean. You won't see a single piece of tape or thread coming out of MS' bat," Amit Mishra tweeted.

334.title: Investigating it myself: Scindia after IndiGo denies boarding to differently-abled child
334.article_body: Union Civil Aviation Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said he is investigating the matter himself wherein IndiGo denied boarding to a differently-abled child at the Ranchi airport. He added that appropriate action will also be taken. A social media post along with a video of the incident went viral on Sunday after it detailed how IndiGo staff denied boarding to the child.

335.title: I'm happy south films RRR & KGF 2 are doing great numbers at box office: Yami
335.article_body: Speaking about films like 'RRR' and 'KGF: Chapter 2', actress Yami Gautam said focusing on the story and script and allowing a director's vision to come to life on the big screen is a key determining factor in the success of these films. "The way they're doing great numbers at the box office. I'm really happy about that," she added.

336.title: Dad had no money for mom's discharge, Chetan Anand gave him ₹400: Amjad's son
336.article_body: Late actor Amjad Khan's son, Shadaab Khan, said his father did not have money to pay for his mother, Shehla Khan's discharge from the hospital when he was born. "[My dad] was ashamed to show his face. [Late] Chetan Anand...happened to see my father holding his head in corner...[he] gave him ₹400...so that my mother and I could come home."

337.title: British airline EasyJet to take out seats from planes so it can fly with fewer crew
337.article_body: British low-cost airline EasyJet plans to remove seats on some of its planes so it can operate flights with fewer cabin crew. The airline, which has been facing a staff shortage, is cancelling around 30 flights daily. It will be removing the back row from 60 of its A319 jets, which will limit the passengers to 150 instead of 156.

338.title: Shiv Sena's marriage was arranged with BJP, it ran with others: Union Minister
338.article_body: Union Minister Raosaheb Patil Danve on Sunday said Shiv Sena's marriage was arranged with the BJP but it "ran away" with others. "Shiv Sena left us (BJP) for the Chief Minister's post (in 2019). We did not leave it. It is up to the people to decide whether they have run away from the BJP or not," Danve added.

339.title: I thought we were getting better but that is not the case: Pant
339.article_body: After they suffered their sixth loss in the ongoing IPL season, DC captain Rishabh Pant said CSK outplayed them in all departments in their match on Sunday. "We have played a lot of close games...I thought we were getting better but that's not the case," he added. CSK posted 208/6 and dismissed DC for 117 to win by 91 runs.

340.title: Only 60 CNG pumps for 2 lakh vehicles in Pune, wait time 1.5 hours: Report
340.article_body: There are only 60 CNG pumps in Pune which serve over 2 lakh vehicles, stretching the waiting time for refuelling to about 1.5 hours for commuters, said a report. "Whenever I go to fill up CNG…there are long queues. So, mostly I prefer to go at night as it takes 30 minutes to one hour," said a commuter.

341.title: No enmity with BJP or RSS but violence shouldn't be tolerated: Gehlot
341.article_body: Rajasthan CM Ashok Gehlot on Sunday said that there is no enmity with BJP or RSS but violence should not be tolerated in any form. "No one should accept violence and those who are ruling should condemn it, no matter which party, caste or religion they belong to," Gehlot added. He was addressing a function at Pinjrapole Gaushala in Sanganer.

342.title: Pune to continue having cloudy weather over next few days: IMD
342.article_body: Pune will continue to witness cloudy skies over the next few days, India Meteorological Department (IMD) has predicted. On Sunday, Pune’s Shivajinagar recorded a maximum temperature of 40.7°C, Pashan 40.8°C and Lohegaon 40.1°C. The minimum temperature recorded in the city was 21.4°C. On Monday, the maximum temperature is predicted to go up to around 40°C.

343.title: India have to find a way to get Karthik in their T20 WC side: Vaughan
343.article_body: Former England captain Michael Vaughan has said Team India will have to find a way to get RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik in their squad for the upcoming T20 World Cup. "With the way that Karthik is playing, he might have to put the commentary microphone down for another T20 World Cup," added Vaughan. Karthik scored 30*(8) against SRH on Sunday.

344.title: BITS offers MBA in Digital Business for working professionals
344.article_body: India will need nine times as many digital skilled workers by 2025, according to an Amazon Web Services report. Aligning with the same, BITS has revealed that its MBA in Digital Business is designed for working professionals and enables participants to learn about emerging technologies and how these technologies can be leveraged to design, build, and manage digital businesses.

345.title: 18-yr-old boy drowns at Pune dam while taking video with friends
345.article_body: An 18-year-old boy drowned at Pune's Khadakwasla Dam after he was washed away when he climbed the pumping station wall and dived. The incident occurred on Saturday while the deceased and his two friends were taking selfies and videos. "Youths today...try doing tricks...to take a picture or a video, which is risky," a city-based rescue and trekking group member said.

346.title: Himachal Pradesh seals borders, books SFJ chief over Khalistan flags at Assembly
346.article_body: Himachal Pradesh Police have booked Sikhs for Justice (SFJ) leader Gurpatwant Singh Pannun under UAPA and "sealed" the state's borders after Khalistani flags were put up at state Assembly complex in Dharamshala. Himachal Pradesh police chief Sanjay Kundu also ordered beefing up of the state-wide security after the SFJ's announcement of a Khalistan "referendum day" on June 6.

347.title: 8 including 6 women die, 20 injured as lorry, mini-truck collide in T'gana
347.article_body: Eight people, including six women, were killed in a collision involving a mini truck and a lorry in Telangana's Kamareddy district on Sunday evening. Twenty people were also injured during the incident that took place around 5 pm on Sunday. Police said that two people died on spot while three others died on way to the hospital.

348.title: Disturbed by friend's long phone call, 23-yr-old man kills him in Punjab
348.article_body: A 23-year-old man, Satyam Kumar, killed his 33-year-old friend, Mohammad Iman, after he reportedly got disturbed by Iman's long telephonic conversation in Punjab's Ludhiana. The two were drinking together on night of May 6 when Iman got a phone call. When Iman disconnected the call, Kumar assaulted him for disturbing him and slit his throat using a razor.

349.title: How does the IPL 2022 points table read after CSK record biggest win of season?
349.article_body: CSK have moved to the eighth position on the IPL 2022 points table after recording the biggest win of the season against DC on Sunday. LSG, GT, RR and RCB constitute the top four, followed by DC, SRH and PBKS, who have 10 points each. MI are currently placed last, while KKR are ninth.

350.title: If I die under mysterious circumstances, nice knowing ya: Musk after Russian threats
350.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has tweeted, "If I die under mysterious circumstances, it's been nice knowing ya." Shortly before this, Musk shared a post that he said was a statement by the Roscosmos director Dmitry Olegovich Rogozin to Russian media that accused Musk of supplying "fascist forces in Ukraine". "Elon, you'll be held accountable like an adult," the statement read.

351.title: B'luru Customs arrest passenger hiding ₹47 lakh-gold in underwear
351.article_body: Bengaluru Customs tweeted on Sunday that a passenger was arrested for allegedly attempting to smuggle gold in paste form, worth over ₹47 lakh, by hiding it in underwear. The passenger had arrived from Abu Dhabi. This is the second such incident in two days after customs seized gold worth over ₹50 lakh from a passenger who reportedly hid it similarly.

352.title: Man, sister give 2 dozen water bottles to Hyd Police on duty; pic surfaces
352.article_body: A Hyderabad police officer shared picture of brother and sister distributing water bottles to police officials on duty. "Vivek of Google India and his sister Vaishnavi, an engineering student, distributed two dozen of water bottles to the police personnel on bandobust duty in hot sun, near Malakpet Fire Station...they said it's their responsibility," the officer wrote.
