353.title: Our little girl is finally home: Priyanka Chopra as she shares 1st pic with daughter
353.article_body: Actress Priyanka Chopra took to Instagram to share the first photo with her daughter Malti Marie on the occasion of Mother’s Day. Sharing the photo that featured Nick Jonas also, she wrote, “After 100 plus days in the NICU, our little girl is finally home...Our next chapter begins now, and our baby is truly a badass. Let's get it MM!"

354.title: 4th match, 4th 100+ score, it's a privilege to watch Pujara: Sussex Cricket
354.article_body: After batter Cheteshwar Pujara scored his fourth successive century for Sussex in County Championship Division Two match against Middlesex, Sussex Cricket took to Twitter to praise him. "It's a privilege to watch Pujara," they wrote. Pujara scored an unbeaten 170 off 197 balls, which includes 22 fours and three sixes. He scored two double centuries(201*, 203) and one ton(109) before.

355.title: CSK record biggest win of IPL 2022, defeat DC
355.article_body: CSK defeated DC by 91 runs on Sunday to register the biggest victory (by runs) of IPL 2022. CSK have now won four matches in the tournament. The previous biggest victory (by runs) in the tournament had come on Saturday, when LSG defeated KKR by 75 runs. CSK will next face MI on Thursday.

356.title: Theekshana has been the steal for CSK, one of the best buys in IPL: Jaffer
356.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said CSK spinner Maheesh Theekshana, who has taken 12 wickets from eight matches so far in IPL 2022, has been outstanding. He added the Sri Lankan is one of the best buys in IPL. "He's been the steal for CSK...has taken five wickets in the powerplay...also has four wickets in the death," he further said.

357.title: Thousands of Lebanese living abroad vote in parliamentary election
357.article_body: Thousands of Lebanese citizens living overseas began voting in a parliamentary election on Sunday. Nearly 2 lakh Lebanese citizens living abroad are eligible to vote in the election, the first since the start of the economic crisis in the country. Notably, voters in Lebanon will cast their ballots on May 15.

358.title: Despite many roadblocks for DC this season, they haven't given up: Jaffer
358.article_body: Ex-India opener Wasim Jaffer said DC haven't given up despite facing many roadblocks like unavailability of foreign players, injury woes and covid concerns from the start of IPL this season. "Credit must be given to them, but still, they are...in the hunt for the playoffs...they might get on a roll soon," he added. DC are currently fifth in the standings.

359.title: Army, police rescue 2 people stuck in J&K river after 5-hr operation
359.article_body: The army and police in J&K's Kishtwar district on Saturday rescued two people from drowning in the Chenab river following a nearly five-hour-long rescue operation. The pair got stuck after attempting to cross the river in their earth-mover. Both were sitting on the roof of the vehicle when they were finally rescued in pitch dark, the officials said

360.title: Badshah buys Audi Q8 worth over ₹1.23 crore, shares picture
360.article_body: Singer Badshah has bought an Audi Q8 worth over ₹1.23 crore and shared a picture while posing with it, on his Instagram handle. The rapper already has several cars including a Rolls Royce Wraith worth over ₹6 crore, which he purchased in 2019. The Audi is reportedly finished in the 'Dragon Orange Metallic' shade.

361.title: Leopard injures policeman, officers in Haryana; attack caught on video
361.article_body: An SHO and two forest department officials leading a rescue operation team to catch a leopard were injured in Haryana's Panipat on Saturday night. A video of the incident showed the animal attacking the rescue team members and it was later successfully tranquilised. The SHO and one of the forest officials were hospitalised but are stable, an official said.

362.title: Didn't win the Oscar as Will Smith beat me, not physically: Benedict
362.article_body: 'Doctor Strange' actor Benedict Cumberbatch made a joke about Will Smith slapping Chris Rock at the Oscars during his Saturday Night Live monologue. "I didn't win the Oscar...I was [beaten] by Will Smith," he said. Benedict quickly added, "Not physically." Will won the Oscar for Best Actor for his performance in 'King Richard'. Benedict was nominated in the same category.

363.title: BJP to play role of responsible Opp'n in Punjab: BL Santhosh
363.article_body: BJP National General Secretary BL Santhosh on Sunday said his party will not allow any compromises with Punjab's interests and will play the role of a responsible Opposition in the state. He also asked BJP leaders and workers to make the public aware of the "false propaganda and hollow promises" made by the Aam Aadmi Party.

364.title: Elon Musk planning a new Twitter product codenamed 'X': Report
364.article_body: World's richest man Elon Musk, who's acquiring Twitter for $44 billion, plans to launch a new Twitter product codenamed "X", according to his investor presentation obtained by The New York Times. Musk expects to launch the product in 2023 and estimates it would have nine million subscribers in its first year and 104 million subscribers by 2028, the NYT reported.

365.title: US imposes new sanctions on 27 Gazprombank, 8 Sberbank executives
365.article_body: The US on Sunday imposed new sanctions against three Russian television stations and banned 27 executives from Gazprombank in response to Ukraine's invasion of Russia. This is the first time that the US has imposed sanctions involving Russian gas exporter Gazprombank. The new sanctions also included eight executives from Sberbank, and Moscow Industrial Bank and its 10 subsidiaries.

366.title: We'll fight as long as we're alive: Ukrainian fighters in Mariupol
366.article_body: Captain Sviatoslav Palamar, a deputy commander of Ukraine's Azov Regiment at Azovstal steel plant in Mariupol, on Sunday said, "We'll continue to fight as long as we're alive". "We can die at any moment...Our message is don't waste our efforts," another fighter said. The fighters are the last remaining Ukrainian resistance against Russian forces in the city.

367.title: Retail investors have become shock absorbers in equities: FM
367.article_body: Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman said retail investors have played a key role in the markets in the last two years. "[They] have shown...what they can do by standing up and becoming shock absorbers, unlike FPIs," she stated. Her statement comes as foreign portfolio investors pulled out ₹6,417 crore from the Indian stock markets in the first week of May.

368.title: School holds 35 students hostage over non-payment of fees in UP's Bareilly
368.article_body: A school in Uttar Pradesh's Bareilly allegedly held at least 35 students hostage over non-payment of their tuition fees. The school administration reportedly locked up the students in a room and the matter came to light when their parents came to pick them up. Meanwhile, the school's parents' organisation has decided to file a complaint against the school authorities.

369.title: Mauritius PM launches 2nd phase of India-Mauritius flagship metro project
369.article_body: Mauritius PM Pravind Jugnauth inaugurated the Quatre Bornes to Phoenix segment of India-Mauritius flagship Metro Express project on Sunday. The project was financed from the $190 billion Line of Credit extended from India in January this year. Prime Minister Narendra Modi along with his Mauritian counterpart had inaugurated the first part of the metro via videoconferencing in 2019.

370.title: Bihar civil services exam cancelled after question paper leaked, probe launched
370.article_body: The Bihar Public Service Commission (BPSC) has cancelled the 67th Combined (Preliminary) Competitive Examination after the question papers were leaked and shared on social media. Bihar Lok Seva Aayog said that the DGP has been requested to get the matter investigated by the Cyber Cell. The Commission had constituted a three-member inquiry panel to probe the leak.

371.title: Army organises 'Educative Health Forum' for women in J&K's Machhal
371.article_body: The Indian Army organised an "Educative Health Forum" in the remote Machhal sector of J&K's Kupwara District this month to counsel women on health issues, education and government schemes. "This is the first time...such a step has been undertaken so close to...Line of Control," the army said. The army had collaborated with a Bengaluru health coach to conduct the sessions.

372.title: US wanted to set up military bases in Pak, wouldn't allow it: Ex-PM
372.article_body: Former Pakistan PM Imran Khan has stated that the US wanted to establish military bases in the country during his tenure, something he would have never allowed. Khan stated that the US wanted bases in Pakistan to "conduct" counter-attacks in case of terrorism in Afghanistan. Notably, Khan had earlier alleged that a 'foreign conspiracy' had tried to topple his government.

373.title: Syrian Prez meets Iranian Prez during surprise visit to Iran
373.article_body: Syrian President Bashar al-Assad made a surprise visit to Iran on Sunday, meeting Iranian Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei and President Ebrahim Raisi. Notably, this is Assad's second trip to Iran since the start of Syria's civil war in 2011. Assad's government has managed to survive due to support from Iran and the military intervention by Russia, according to Reuters.

374.title: Maha govt to seek cancellation of bail given to MP Navneet, husband
374.article_body: The Maharashtra government will seek cancellation of bail given to MP Navneet Rana and her MLA husband Ravi Rana in the Hanuman Chalisa issue, public prosecutor Pradeep Gharat said. A Mumbai court granted bail to the couple on May 4 (Wednesday) and they walked out of jail on Thursday. They were arrested on April 23.

375.title: 'Install cameras at mosques', suggests Owaisi amid communal clashes
375.article_body: AIMIM president Asaduddin Owaisi has suggested that high-resolution CCTV cameras be installed at mosques following recent incidents of communal clashes. While alleging that "Muslims are routinely blamed for problems during communal incidents" he added that whenever any religious procession passes through these areas it should be telecast live so that "people know who are the ones pelting stones".

376.title: Himachal Pradesh CM orders SIT probe into Khalistan flags incident
376.article_body: After Khalistan flags were found tied to the main gate and boundary wall of the Himachal Pradesh Legislative Assembly, CM Jairam Thakur said he has directed police to constitute a Special Investigation Team (SIT) to probe the incident. "Strict action will be taken against the accused...They will not be...spared," Thakur added. "I condemn the cowardly incident," the CM further said.

377.title: 'Arjun Reddy' actor Rahul Ramakrishna announces upcoming wedding
377.article_body: Actor Rahul Ramakrishna, known for portraying Shiva in 2017 Telugu film 'Arjun Reddy', announced on Sunday that he will be marrying his girlfriend Bindu. The actor also shared a picture of the two kissing, writing, "Getting married, finally, soonly!" Rahul has said Bindu was a fan of his work and the two connected when she offered him a lift home.

378.title: Hope hero says he's male Nushrratt: Nushrratt on female Ayushmann tag
378.article_body: Actress Nushrratt Bharuccha reacted to being called a female Ayushmann Khurrana during the trailer launch event of 'Janhit Mein Jaari'. She said she has worked with Ayushmann in 'Dreamgirl' and added, "I'm sure he has rubbed off...in the right way." "Hope someday some hero says, he's the female Nushrratt Bharuccha," she added. Nushrratt plays a condom salesgirl in the film.

379.title: Preity shares pic of twins, says 'Beginning to understand motherhood'
379.article_body: Preity Zinta shared a picture of her twins and mother on social media on Sunday to mark Mother's Day. She wrote, "From thinking of myself first to learning to put my kids first, I'm beginning to understand what motherhood is all about." Preity further wrote she hopes her kids are more appreciative of her than she was of her mother.

380.title: Former J&K Education Minister Harsh Dev Singh joins AAP
380.article_body: Former J&K Education Minister and National Panthers Party (NPP) chief, Harsh Dev Singh, joined AAP in presence of party leader Sanjay Singh in New Delhi on Saturday. "The problems plaguing J&K can only be addressed by eradicating corruption and ensuring good governance, like...AAP has done in Delhi," Singh said after joining. Notably, he's the third NPP leader to join AAP.

381.title: WeWork India turns profitable, reports 40% y-o-y growth
381.article_body: Bengaluru-based WeWork India turned profitable for the first time during January-March 2022. The co-working space company reported an operating margin of ₹25 crore during this period, with around 40% year-on-year growth. CEO Karan Virwani said the company is expecting 33% growth in revenue in 2022 at around ₹1,000 crore, compared to 2021's revenue of ₹750 crore.

382.title: Woman cheated of ₹6.47 lakh in online investment fraud in Chandigarh
382.article_body: Police in Chandigarh have booked an unidentified online fraudster for cheating a woman of ₹6.47 lakh after posing as a Bima Lokpal employee. The complainant said the accused called her to discuss an old insurance policy's pending balance amount and insisted she deposit money to receive a bonus on a refundable investment. Her money was, however, never returned.

383.title: Man rapes 14-yr-old mentally challenged niece in Punjab, booked
383.article_body: A 29-year-old man has been booked for allegedly raping his 14-year-old mentally challenged niece in Punjab's Ludhiana on Saturday. "I had gone out for some work, leaving my 14-year-old daughter...at home," the victim's mother said adding she returned to find the accused sexually assaulting her. Police suspect that the accused had been sexually assaulting the victim for a long time.

384.title: Australia cricketer Head, fiancée's flight skids into a field after emergency landing
384.article_body: Australia cricketer Travis Head's fiancée Jessica Davies took to Instagram to reveal how their flight slid into a field after an emergency landing at an island while they were returning from their holiday in Maldives. Calling it terrifying, Jessica wrote, "It was like watching a movie." She added that they had to wait for four hours for a rescue plane.

385.title: Du Plessis, Karthik then De Silva, the 3D effect for RCB: RP Singh
385.article_body: Following RCB's 67-run win against SRH in IPL 2022, RP Singh tweeted, "Faf Du Plessis, Dinesh Karthik...then Wanindu Hasaranga De Silva! The 3D effect for RCB." Du Plessis top-scored with an unbeaten 50-ball 73, while Karthik hit 30*. De Silva took a five-wicket haul. "Brilliant five-fer from De Silva made sure they stayed in the race to...play-offs!" tweeted Harbhajan Singh.

386.title: No religious events will be allowed on UP roads: CM Adityanath
386.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has warned that no religious event will be allowed on the roads of the state to avert communal tension. Adityanath said that such events should take place inside the premises of religious places. Last month, Adityanath had said that no religious procession should be taken out without permission and loudspeakers shouldn't cause inconvenience to others.

387.title: I blacked out, couldn't breathe: Bella Hadid on her Met Gala dress
387.article_body: Bella Hadid, in an interview, talked about her Met Gala appearance and the dress she wore. Talking about how she "blacked out", she said, "People literally stand there for 20 minutes…I don't think I was out there for more than three minutes...Don't know if that was my anxiety, or maybe the waist was giving cinch and I couldn’t breathe."

388.title: Had no intention of physically harming Kejriwal: BJP leader Bagga
388.article_body: Delhi BJP leader Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga on Sunday said he had no intention of physically harming Kejriwal. "All I had said was that till [Kejriwal] apologises (for his statement on The Kashmir Files), I will not let him live peacefully. This does not mean that I had any intention of physically harming him," Bagga said.

389.title: I've studied every song sung by Lata Mangeshkar: Palak Muchhal
389.article_body: Singer Palak Muchhal, who will be paying tribute to late singer Lata Mangeshkar in the series 'Naam Reh Jaayega', has said, "Lata ji has been my ultimate inspiration." She added, "I've grown up listening to her songs, learning her songs. Palak further stated that she has "literally" studied every song sung by the late singer "like a chapter".

390.title: No amount of gerrymandering can change situation in J&K: Abdullah
390.article_body: Former Jammu and Kashmir Chief Minister Farooq Abdullah on Saturday said that no amount of gerrymandering can change the ground situation in J&K and Ladakh. "People have made it a point to punish BJP and its proxies for all they have done to J&K. Inflation, unemployment and development deficit have compounded the worries of our people immensely," he added.

391.title: 1 out of every 10 unicorns in the world today has been founded in India
391.article_body: With Open becoming India's 100th unicorn (startup with a valuation of $1 billion or above), one out of every 10 unicorns in the world has been founded in India, the government said. India is now home to 100 unicorn startups with a total valuation of $332.7 billion. Within the first four months of 2022, 14 Indian startups achieved unicorn status.

392.title: At times we didn't know how we'll pay rent, you didn't panic: Smriti on her mother
392.article_body: Women and Child Development Minister Smriti Irani paid tribute to her mother on Mother's Day and said, "You have never had it easy." Sharing a picture with her mother Shibani Bagchi, Irani said, "There were times when I didn't know how...next month's house rent could be afforded but I never saw you panic, never heard you curse our fate."

393.title: Faced hurdles getting into OTT when I was barely out of TV: Rithvik
393.article_body: Rithvik Dhanjani said he, initially, faced "some hurdles" while being considered for OTT projects when he was "barely out" of the TV industry. "But in recent times, the industry is more accepting, they know...we know our jobs," he stated. "I get offered different kinds of parts. The casting directors I've heard from feel...I can pull them off," he added.

394.title: 55-year-old Russian climber dies at camp on Mount Everest
394.article_body: A 55-year-old Russian climber died at camp I of Mount Everest, a Nepali official confirmed on Sunday. The deceased, Pavel Kostrikin, fell sick at camp II and died after he was brought back to camp I, the official added. Kostrikin's demise is reported to be first death of a foreigner on peak in current climbing season which began in March.

395.title: Delhi reports 1,422 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 5,939
395.article_body: Delhi reported 1,422 new COVID-19 cases on Sunday as compared to 1,407 cases recorded on Saturday. The city saw zero deaths in the last 24 hours while the positivity rate stood at 5.34% as compared to 4.72% reported on Saturday. The number of active COVID-19 cases in the city was 5,939 as compared to 5,955 on Saturday.

396.title: Canadian PM Justin Trudeau makes unannounced visit to Ukraine
396.article_body: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau on Sunday made an unannounced visit to Ukraine amid the war in the country. Trudeau visited the Ukrainian town of Irpin, which was retaken from Russian forces in late March. In a statement, Trudeau's office said, "The PM is in Ukraine to meet with President (Volodymyr) Zelenskyy and reaffirm Canada's unwavering support for...Ukrainian people."

397.title: Mom said give it your all, I continually put in good work: Madhuri
397.article_body: Madhuri Dixit, on being asked about the secret of her success, said her mother told her to give it her all and put in hard work with dedication. She further said she started very early but began questioning her decision as it wasn't working out. "But I continued to put in...good work...'Tezaab' proved to be an overnight success," Madhuri added.

398.title: Ukrainian troops have retreated from Popasna: Luhansk Governor
398.article_body: Ukrainian troops have retreated from the eastern Ukrainian city of Popasna, Serhiy Gaidai, the governor of the Ukrainian breakaway region of Luhansk said on Sunday. Gaidai's remarks came as the head of Russia's republic of Chechnya, Ramzan Kadyrov, confirmed that his troops had taken control of Popasna. Russia launched a military offensive in eastern Ukraine last month.

399.title: Won't blame Munawar Faruqui for not winning 'Lock Upp': Anjali Arora
399.article_body: Anjali Arora said that she will not blame her friendship with Munawar Faruqui as the reason for not winning the reality show 'Lock Upp'. "I won't like to make that an excuse. My friendship with Munawar is a different side," she stated. "I may not understand a lot about reality shows but I will never blame him," Anjali added.

400.title: Around 500 doctors join BJP in Gujarat ahead of Assembly elections
400.article_body: Around 500 doctors joined the BJP in Gujarat's Gandhinagar on Sunday. The doctors were inducted into the party in the presence of CM Bhupendra Patel and state BJP chief CR Paatil. Gujarat Assembly elections are slated to be held later this year. Paatil had earlier asked party workers to continuously work for the next six months after May 4.

401.title: Chelsea beat Man Utd to win Women's Super League for 3rd time in a row
401.article_body: Chelsea won FA Women's Super League title for the third consecutive time after a 4-2 come-from-behind win against Manchester United on Sunday. Chelsea scored three goals after being 2-1 down at half-time. Arsenal beat West Ham United 2-0 and finished second on 55 points, just one behind Chelsea. Manchester City secured the final Champions League spot as they finished third.
